title: Part-Time Accounting Manager / Full-Charge Bookkeeper (US Janitorial Company – 30 hrs/week – Long-Term)
description:
About Us

We are a growing US-based janitorial services company doing several million dollars per year. We are stable, profitable, and growing.

We are looking for a highly responsible, detail-oriented Accounting Manager to take full ownership of our bookkeeping, payroll, accounts receivable, and cash flow management.

This is NOT a basic data entry role.

This role protects company cash flow and ensures we never overpay vendors or contractors.

We want someone who takes pride in accuracy and accountability.

________________________________________

  Responsibilities

You will be fully responsible for:

• Accounts Receivable (Collections and follow-up)

• Monitoring overdue invoices and ensuring payment

• Accounts Payable (ensuring no unnecessary or duplicate payments)

• Reviewing contractor billing for overcharges

• Payroll processing (employees + contractors)

• Weekly cash flow report

• Tracking Purchase Orders (POs) and job expenses

• Budget monitoring

• Contractor compliance tracking

• Preparing monthly financial reports

• Making sure the company does not lose money due to errors

You will report directly to the owner.

________________________________________

  The Type of Person We Want

• Extremely detail-oriented

• Strong English communication (written and spoken)

• Comfortable following up on overdue payments

• Not afraid to send reminders or escalate issues

• Protective of company money

• Organized and structured

• High integrity

• Takes ownership (does not wait to be told what to do)

• Wants a long-term role (3+ years)

If you prefer to just “do tasks” and wait for instructions, this is NOT the right role.

________________________________________

  Required Experience

• 3+ years bookkeeping/accounting experience

• Experience with US clients

• Experience handling payroll

• Experience managing Accounts Receivable collections

• Experience reviewing vendor or contractor billing

• Experience with QuickBooks (required)

• Strong Excel skills

Bonus:

• Experience in service-based companies

• Experience tracking job-level costs

________________________________________

 Compensation

$10-$15 per hour (depending on experience)

30 hours per week

Performance bonuses possible based on cash flow improvements

________________________________________

   Application Instructions (Important)

To apply, please include:

1. A short 2–3 minute video introduction (Loom preferred)

2. A brief explanation of how you handle overdue invoices (60+ days past due)

3. Your experience with US payroll

4. Your expected monthly salary

5. The word “CASHFLOW” in your subject line

Applications without these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Virtual Administrative Assistant - City Permits for Home Services (HVAC, Plumbing, Electrical)
description:
Job Description:

We are a US Based company looking to hire an experienced Permit Expeditor. A Permit Expeditor is responsible for managing the end-to-end process of securing city permits on behalf of contractors. This includes preparing applications, submitting them to city portals, following up on open jobs, resolving issues with city departments, contractors and homeowners, and updating clients on progress. Online runners handle city submissions through online portals,
, and phone communications.



Key Responsibilities:

• Review contractor-provided documentation for accuracy and completeness before submission.

• Submit permit applications through city or county online portals or via
, following jurisdiction-specific requirements.

• Communicate professionally with city officials to resolve missing information, clarifications, or additional requirements.

• Track the status of permit applications and proactively follow up until the permit is issued.

• Update internal systems (CRM Portal) with accurate notes and status changes.

• Notify clients (contractors) of permit progress, fees, or additional steps needed.

• Ensure all required attachments, corrections, or revisions are submitted on time.



Skills & Qualifications:

• Outside the box thinker

• Strong attention to detail and ability to follow jurisdiction-specific requirements.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.

• Strong problem-solving skills and persistence when following up with cities.

• Tech-savvy and comfortable working with online portals,
, and internal systems.



Software Applications we Commonly Use:

• Zoho

• Airtable

• 

• Ring Central

• Excel



Hours:

• 40 Hours per week, Monday - Friday

• 8AM-4PM PST USA

• (may change to earlier hours to start such as 5AM PST)

• Candidates must be flexible in working hours.



Type of Online Runners we Need:

• Very Detail-Oriented: They must carefully follow city instructions and ensure all paperwork is accurate.

• Persistent and Organized: They should follow up consistently with cities and manage multiple permits without losing track.

• Professional Communicators: Able to
, call, and document interactions clearly and respectfully.

• Quick Learners: Comfortable adapting to different city processes and online platforms.

• Reliable and Self-Managed: Since they work remotely, they need to stay productive and accountable without direct supervision.



Other Requirements:

• Reliable Internet

• Reliable Power Source

• Preferably 2 monitors for multi-tasking

• Clear communication in English



We are looking for long-term, highly dedicated outside the box thinkers. Candidates must be able to push through difficult work times and have a go-getter mentality.

title: Creative AI Video & Ad Specialist
description:
PORTFOLIO REQUIRED: Applications without a portfolio demonstrating both

Canva video ads and AI-generated content (images, video, voice) will be ignored.

To apply, you MUST start your cover letter with the word “AI Creative” so we know

you have read this entire post.

Hi there! We are AT Media Partners, a leading Meta ads agency for home service

businesses in Australia. We are looking for a highly skilled and process-driven Creative

AI Video & Ad Specialist to join our remote team.

This is a production role, not a strategy role. We are looking for a “doer” who loves

systems and is an expert with Canva and AI creative tools.

Your Mission:

Our media buyer will hand you a winning ad concept, a script, and a client brand kit.

Your job is to use Canva and AI tools to produce a high volume of high-quality video

and image ad variations with speed and precision.

What You Will Do:

Recreate Winning Ads: Deconstruct winning competitor ads and rebuild them as

reusable Canva templates.

Generate New Concepts: Pitch new video ad concepts based on patterns you

see in our swipe file.

Produce Variations: Adapt hooks, angles, and structures from competitor ads

into new variations for our clients.

AI Asset Generation: Use AI tools to create photorealistic images, short video

clips, and clear voiceovers.

Ad Assembly: Combine all assets into polished, high-performing video ads in all

Meta formats (Reels, Stories, Feed).

You Are a Perfect Fit If:

You are an expert in Canva for video ad creation.

You have a strong portfolio of AI-generated images (Midjourney, DALL-E 3),

videos (RunwayML, Pika Labs), and voiceovers (ElevenLabs, Play.ht).

You are obsessed with detail and following instructions perfectly.

You love systems and processes and find satisfaction in executing a proven

formula.

You are fast, reliable, and highly organized.

What We Offer:

100% Remote Work: Work from anywhere.

Clear Instructions: You will receive a detailed brief for every project. No

guesswork.

Innovative Environment: Be part of a team that is at the cutting edge of AI in

advertising.

Consistent Workflow: A steady stream of projects from our diverse client base.

To Apply:

1. Start your cover letter with the words “AI Creative”.

2. Provide a link to your portfolio that includes both Canva video ads and AIgenerated content.

3. Briefly explain why you are the perfect fit for a production-focused role.

title: Leasing + Property Management Coordinator VA (US LTR) – Part-Time 20 hrs/wk (9AM–1PM ET)
description:
We need an organized, operations-minded VA who is great at follow-up. The job is to run lease-up (inquiries -> showings -> applications -> lease signing) and keep maintenance + rent follow-ups moving, using RentRedi + trackers. If you never drop tasks and you live by checklists, this will be a great fit.



No bookkeeping. No QuickBooks.



GROWTH PATH



This role has a strong path to more hours and full-time (9AM–5PM ET) after a successful 90-day trial, based on performance and business needs.



REQUIRED SCHEDULE

Mon–Fri, 9:00 AM–1:00 PM US Eastern

No overlapping job during these hours

Quick check (KPI): Mon–Fri 4:30–5:00 PM ET for urgent tenant messages + MTR check-in issues only.

During shift hours, we aim to respond to leasing/tenant messages within 1 business hour.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES (PHASE 1 – NOW)

Lease-Up (Core)

- Respond to inquiries using templates

- Pre-screen prospects + schedule showings

- Track applications + follow up for missing items

- Coordinate screening steps and move qualified applicants to signed lease

- Move-in coordination (funds, utilities start, portal setup)



PM Ops (Core)

- Maintenance coordination: collect details/photos, schedule vendors, follow up to completion

- Rent follow-up: send reminders using templates + document notes/promises-to-pay

- Turnovers: coordinate cleaners/vendors + checklist + photos

- Keep trackers and Drive folders updated daily

- Help enforce portal-first communication (RentRedi)



MTR/STR (Bonus)

We have two MTRs (typical stays ~2 months) and only use STR to fill vacancies. If you have MTR/STR ops experience, you can earn extra per event (details below).



MUST-HAVES

- Philippines-based

- US LTR leasing and/or property management support experience (Airbnb-only is not enough)

- Strong written English + clear spoken English (video required)

- Very organized + strong follow-up habits

- Comfortable with Google Sheets/Drive

- Reliable internet + backup connection

- Comfortable joining a 5-minute live call during the final interview stage.



NOT A FIT IF

Airbnb-only experience (no leasing/LTR PM), or you cannot commit to the required schedule.



PAY / BONUSES

Salary is PHP 27,500–30,000/month based on KPI performance.

KPI Bonus: PHP 2,500/month (performance-based).

MTR/STR bonus pay (optional): PHP 1,500 per turnover; PHP 500 per check-in day.



HOW TO APPLY (REQUIRED)

If you do not answer all questions + include video + resume, we will skip your application.

Put “PM022826” on the first line of your OLJ message.



1. Confirm you can work Mon–Fri 9AM–1PM ET with no overlap job.

2. Confirm you can do the 4:30–5:00 PM ET quick check (Mon–Fri).

3. Years of US leasing and/or LTR PM support experience:

4. Lease-up workflow in 6 steps (inquiry -> showing -> application -> screening -> lease -> move-in):

5. Maintenance coordination workflow in 5 steps:

6. Late rent follow-up cadence:

7. Tools used (RentRedi/AppFolio/Buildium/etc.):

8. Internet speed + backup connection:

9. VIDEO LINK (Required): 90 seconds–2.5 minutes using the script below. Important: Say PM022826 at the end of your video.

10. Resume: attach in OLJ OR Google Drive link

If using Google Drive, set sharing to “Anyone with the link can view.”



Shortlisted applicants receive a short form + paid skills test.



VIDEO SCRIPT (Required) – 90 seconds to 2.5 minutes

Record a quick video (Loom or unlisted YouTube). No editing needed. Answer in order:



1. Name + schedule confirmation - Name, City/Province, confirm Mon–Fri 9–1 ET + Mon–Fri 4:30–5:00 ET quick check.

2. Lease-up - Briefly describe one lease-up you handled and your 6 steps (inquiry -> showing -> application -> screening -> lease -> move-in).

3. Maintenance coordination - Your 5-step process from first tenant message to completion.

4. Late rent follow-up - Your cadence (Day 1/3/5 etc.) and how you log promises-to-pay.

5. Tools + portal-first - Tools you’ve used (RentRedi or similar + Google Sheets). Confirm you’re comfortable with a portal-first approach.

6. Internet + close - Internet speed + backup, and one sentence on why you’re great at follow-up/trackers.

Also confirm: “I’m comfortable speaking with tenants/vendors/prospects when needed.”



End by saying: “My application code is PM022826.”

title: Remote Virtual Assistant – Customer Service & eCommerce Operations
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking reliable, detail-oriented Remote Virtual Assistants to join our growing team. In this role, you will serve as the frontline of our customer experience — managing our
 inbox, monitoring our eCommerce dashboard, and overseeing our ShipStation dashboard to ensure smooth, timely, and professional communication with our customers.

This is a full-time position (40+ hours per week) with multiple shifts available to provide round-the-clock coverage. We are looking for self-motivated individuals who take pride in delivering excellent service.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Monitor and manage the customer
 inbox, ensuring all inquiries receive prompt and professional responses

Respond to customer questions related to orders, shipping, product information, returns, and general service inquiries

Keep the inbox organized, clean, and up to date — archiving, labeling, and flagging
s as appropriate

Navigate the eCommerce dashboard to look up order details, check statuses, and assist with customer account inquiries

Use ShipStation to track shipments, verify order fulfillment statuses, and relay accurate shipping information to customers

Escalate issues that fall outside your scope to the appropriate supervisor in a timely manner

Maintain a professional, courteous, and helpful tone in all customer interactions

Follow established response templates and guidelines, adapting as needed for each situation

Document recurring issues and flag them to management for process improvement





REQUIREMENTS



Fluent in written English — clear, professional, and grammatically accurate communication is essential

Prior experience in customer service, virtual assistance, or
 management (1+ year preferred)

Familiarity with eCommerce platforms (Shopify, WooCommerce, or similar) is a strong asset

Experience with ShipStation or other order/shipping management platforms is a plus

Able to work independently and manage time effectively in a remote environment

Reliable high-speed internet connection and a dedicated, distraction-free workspace

Available to commit to a set shift schedule on an ongoing, full-time basis

Strong attention to detail and commitment to accuracy





WHAT WE OFFER



Full-time remote work — work from anywhere

Multiple shift options to accommodate your time zone and availability

Stable, ongoing hours (40+ per week)

Clear team structure with escalation support

Opportunity to grow within a dynamic and expanding eCommerce operation





HOW TO APPLY

Please send us the following:



Your resume or CV highlighting relevant experience

A brief introduction explaining why you are a great fit for this role

Your preferred shift availability and current time zone

Any examples of previous customer service or inbox management work (optional but encouraged)



We review applications on a rolling basis and look forward to hearing from you!

title: Tutoring Remote Work - Fresh Nursing Grads or RNs ONLY
description:
Online Healthcare Tutor Clinical Documentation Improvement Track



“Fresh Nursing Graduates or Registered Nurses Welcome”



Nonprofit Academic Initiative Philippines

Gig Based Compensation



We are currently in the early development stage of a nonprofit academic initiative focused on strengthening healthcare education and building a future Clinical Documentation Improvement group in the Philippines. At this time, planning and deliberation are ongoing as we carefully structure the program.



Our long term goal is to create structured opportunities for nursing graduates, both fresh and experienced, to participate in Clinical Documentation Improvement work. CDI is a growing field in healthcare where nurses excel because of their clinical background, critical thinking, and understanding of patient care. With additional knowledge in medical coding and documentation standards, nurses can transition into valuable documentation improvement roles.



We are seeking Bachelor of Science in Nursing graduates, including fresh graduates, to provide online tutoring and academic guidance in healthcare related subjects. Registered Nurses are preferred but not required.



This role begins on a gig basis. As the initiative develops and if the project progresses successfully, a more structured engagement plan may be discussed.



Role Responsibilities



Provide structured online tutoring in healthcare and nursing subjects

Assist students in improving academic performance

Support understanding of clinical documentation standards

Introduce basic medical coding awareness

Help develop foundational materials for future CDI training

Monitor student progress and provide feedback



Qualifications



Bachelor of Science in Nursing required

Fresh graduates welcome

RN license preferred but not mandatory

Strong academic performance required

Interest in clinical documentation and medical coding is an advantage

Professional, responsible, and detail oriented



Compensation



This is a gig based opportunity with performance based compensation. Further structure will be discussed as the program advances.

? OCR pipeline that reads cannabis invoices and extracts product data (name, SKU, quantity, price)

? Claude AI (Anthropic) integration for intelligent document parsing and autofill

? API integrations with METRC (cannabis compliance) and Dutchie (POS system)

? Clean web dashboard where dispensary staff upload invoices and verify autofilled data



---



YOU NEED:



? 3+ years full-stack experience (React or Next.js + Node.js or Python)

? Experience with OCR tools (Google Vision, AWS Textract, or similar)

? REST API integration experience — you've connected third party systems before

? Ability to work independently and communicate clearly in English

? Portfolio of real SaaS or web app projects you can show us





WHAT WE OFFER:



? Fully remote, flexible hours

? Paid test task before commitment (we respect your time)

? Ground floor opportunity — first dev hire at a funded startup

? Real product, real customers, real impact



---



TO APPLY:

Send us your
 and a 2-3 sentence answer to this question:



"If you had to build an OCR pipeline that reads a cannabis invoice photo and extracts product names, quantities, and prices — what tools would you use and why?"



Resume optional.  Just your answer and your
. We'll review portfolios in round 2.

title: Dating App Manager (Hinge + Tinder) – Full-Time | Experienced Only
description:
I’m hiring a full-time Dating App Manager to run my Hinge and Tinder profiles.



You must have prior experience managing dating apps for paying clients.



This role requires understanding how to safely operate accounts from a different location without triggering bans.



If you don’t understand device/IP structure, geo-consistency, session stability, and how to avoid cross-account contamination — do not apply.



This is not mass swiping. This is precision.



What You’ll Do



Operate accounts safely from a separate location using proper infrastructure

(clean devices, non-flagged IP setup, no random VPN usage, no shared/burned devices)



Swipe strategically based on my exact type (I’ll provide examples)



Start and carry natural, confident, flirty conversations in my tone



Pre-qualify and send high-quality leads daily (not raw matches)



Pace activity properly to avoid flags or throttling



Work Dubai timezone (morning + evening shifts preferred)



Weekend availability is a plus



Full-time. Performance-based.



To Apply (Answer All 3)



If you’re managing an account for a client in Dubai while you’re in another country, explain exactly how you’d structure the device and IP setup to prevent flags or bans.



Based on your past client work, how did you measure whether an account was performing well? What metrics or signals told you your swiping and messaging strategy was working?



Describe a real example where your swiping and messaging directly increased the quality of dates for a client. What did you change?



How soon can you start?



What is the most competitive pay?



Only apply if you’ve done this before.

title: Senior Accountant – Remote | Full-Time | USD Salary
description:
About Aidventure

Aidventure is a growing accounting and AI consulting firm serving small and mid-sized businesses across North America. We work in a fast-paced, remote-first environment where ownership, communication, and reliability are non-negotiable. We’re a small team that moves fast and holds each other to a high standard.

The Role

We’re looking for a Senior Accountant to own our client accounting operations end to end. This is a full-time remote position, paid in USD, working directly with the founder. You won’t just execute tasks — you’ll build and own the systems that keep our clients financially healthy and organized.

What You’ll Own

 - Month-end close process for multiple US-based clients — building and executing checklists

 - QuickBooks Online and Xero bookkeeping and reconciliations

 - Client invoicing, payment follow-up, and aging reports

 - Cash flow monitoring and financial reporting

 - Managing and reviewing the work of a junior bookkeeper

 - Building and documenting accounting SOPs so the team operates without bottlenecks

What We Expect From You

 - Proactive daily communication — you update us, we don’t chase you

 - Full-time availability, 40 hours per week

 - Overlap with US Eastern time zone for at least 6 hours daily

 - You flag problems early, not after they’ve compounded

 - You build processes, not just complete tasks

 - Comfortable working independently with minimal hand-holding

Requirements

 - 5+ years of accounting experience

 - Strong English — written and verbal

 - Hands-on experience with QuickBooks Online and/or Xero

 - Experience working with US-based clients or employers preferred

 - Degree in Accounting or Finance

 - CPA or equivalent certification is a plus

Nice to Have

 - Experience in a multi-client or outsourced accounting environment

 - Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT or Claude

 - Experience with project management tools like Notion or ClickUp

 - FP&A or financial reporting experience

Compensation

$800 – $1,200/month USD based on experience, paid monthly.

To Apply

Please include your CV and a brief note on your experience with QuickBooks Online and one example of a process or system you built or improved in a previous role.

title: Project Manager | Low Voltage Security Systems
description:
SynergizeX Inc. is seeking an experienced Project Manager to oversee multiple low-voltage security installation projects throughout North America. This role is ideal for a highly organized, solutions-oriented professional who thrives in fast-paced construction environments and can confidently manage field operations, subcontractors, and client communication from kickoff to closeout.



You will play a key role in ensuring projects are delivered on time, within scope, and with strong documentation discipline.



Key Responsibilities:

• Develop and maintain detailed project schedules, task plans, and weekly execution priorities

• Coordinate technicians and subcontractors, including dispatching, daily check-ins, and progress tracking

• Monitor scope, site constraints, and trade dependencies to prevent delays

• Manage RFIs, site inquiries, and change order inputs in a structured and timely manner

• Lead client communications, meeting documentation, and action item follow-up

• Maintain accurate project documentation, status reports, and closeout packages

• Track labor targets, deliverables, and milestone performance

• Identify risks early and recommend practical, field-ready solutions



Project Types:

• Access control system installations

• Video surveillance (CCTV) deployments

• Structured cabling and pathway coordination

• Construction site coordination and project closeout support



What Success Looks Like:

• Clear, consistent weekly reporting to clients and internal teams

• Field teams arrive prepared, informed, and equipped

• Issues are documented, tracked, and resolved proactively

• Projects close cleanly with complete documentation and minimal punch list items



Qualifications:

• 3+ years of project management experience in construction, low voltage, or security systems

• Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

• Strong scheduling, coordination, and prioritization skills

• Confident written and verbal communication

• Ability to read drawings, interpret scopes, device lists, and floor plans

• Excellent organizational and documentation habits

• Reliable internet connection and professional remote workspace



Preferred Experience:

• Background in access control, CCTV, intrusion, intercom, or structured cabling

• Familiarity with tools such as Google Workspace, Excel, Smartsheet, Monday, Asana, or MS Project

• Experience coordinating subcontractors and multi-trade job sites



Work Schedule:

• Full-time position with required overlap during Eastern Time business hours

• Occasional early morning or late-day calls may be required for site coordination





If you are proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable managing technical installation projects in a construction-driven environment, we encourage you to apply and join our growing team at SynergizeX Inc.

title: HR Virtual Assistant / Interview Coordinator
description:
Company: Core Mind Technology  

Role: HR Virtual Assistant / Interview Coordinator  

Employment Type: Full-Time  

Work Setup: Remote  

Schedule: Schedule: 9/10pm - 6/7am PST (8am - 5pm Central Time USA) {Daylight Savings Shifts the schedule 2 times per year}





About Core Mind Technology



Core Mind Technology builds AI-powered automation and digital service solutions, with a strong focus on clear systems, high-quality talent, and scalable operations. We are growing and need a HR Virtual Assistant / Interview Coordinator who can own day-to-day recruiting and HR coordination so leadership can focus on strategy and delivery.



This is a systems-driven HR role where you will help design and maintain structured hiring and onboarding workflows—not just post jobs and send
s.



About the Role



You will manage candidate pipelines, run structured initial interviews, coordinate with hiring managers, and help build HR processes that are consistent and data-informed. You’ll be responsible for ensuring that candidates have a smooth experience and that our internal team always knows exactly where each candidate is in the process.



You will work closely with leadership and collaborate with different divisions (AI automation, digital services, and internal operations) as we continue to grow our team.



Key Responsibilities



You will be responsible for:

- Posting and updating job listings on OnlineJobs.ph and other platforms  

- Sourcing and shortlisting candidates based on clear role scorecards and criteria  

- Reviewing resumes and screening answers for fit and red flags  

- Conducting 15–20 minute initial screening interviews via Zoom/Google Meet using our scripts  

- Taking structured notes and scoring candidates against predefined scorecards  

- Coordinating interviews with hiring managers and internal stakeholders  

- Managing calendars, sending invites, and following up with reminders  

- Keeping an organized candidate pipeline in our tracking system (ATS/Sheets/Notion)  

- Sending timely updates to candidates (next steps, rejections, follow-ups) using templates  

- Assisting with offer coordination and pre-onboarding communication  

- Supporting onboarding checklists: document collection, first-day schedule, system access coordination  

- Helping maintain and improve HR SOPs, templates, and internal hiring documentation  



Tools & Workflow



You may work with tools such as:



- Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar, Gmail)  

- Zoom / Google Meet  

- Scheduling tools (e.g., Calendly or similar)  

- Internal tracking tools (Notion, Airtable, or spreadsheets)  

- Slack (or similar) for internal communication  

- Applicant tracking / HR dashboards as we implement them  



We value people who can follow existing SOPs and also propose workflow improvements as they learn the systems.



What We’re Looking For



We’re looking for someone who:



- Has 2+ years of experience in HR, recruitment, or as a VA handling hiring/interview coordination  

- Is confident speaking with candidates on calls and video, and represents the company well  

- Has excellent written and spoken English  

- Is highly detail-oriented, consistent, and process-driven  

- Can manage multiple roles and candidates in parallel without dropping details  

- Is organized, deadline-driven, and comfortable working with minimal micromanagement  

- Communicates clearly and professionally in remote, asynchronous environments  

- Is comfortable working with US-based businesses and time zones  



Nice to Have



- Experience hiring for remote roles in tech, digital services, or startups  

- Experience using an ATS or structured recruitment tracking tools  

- Familiarity with basic HR concepts (onboarding, probation, simple policies)  



Compensation (PECP-style Model)



We use a performance- and completion-aware structure similar in spirit to PECP:

- Competitive monthly salary ranging from $400 to $700 in PHP, aligned with experience and capability  

- Payout on a regular, predictable schedule  

- Performance-based bonuses available based on:

  - Speed and quality of hiring pipeline management  

  - Candidate experience and communication quality  

  - Accuracy, organization, and completeness of records  

  - Process improvements and documentation you introduce  



High performers may be eligible for:



- Compensation increases  

- Expanded HR responsibilities (policy support, people operations projects)  

- A long-term People Operations / HR leadership growth track within Core Mind Technology  





Benefits



- Long-term, stable remote role with US hours  

- Close collaboration with leadership and visibility into multiple business units  



Additional Benefits After 90 Days



Upon successfully completing a 90-day probation period and meeting performance expectations, Core Mind Technology will provide:



- A MacBook for work use, funded by the company  

- A battery backup / UPS system to help during power interruptions  

- High-speed internet funded by the company (either direct payment or a fixed monthly allowance)  

- Healthcare coverage, with details discussed during the interview and confirmed in your contract  





Ideal For



This role is ideal for:



- Experienced HR/recruitment virtual assistants  

- Coordinators who enjoy structured processes and clear documentation  

- Remote professionals who love organizing people, information, and schedules  

- Individuals looking for a long-term, growth-oriented position in a tech-forward company  





How to Apply



Please send:

- Your resume  

- A short summary (3–6 sentences) of your HR / recruitment / VA experience 

- The tools you’ve used for scheduling, interviewing, and tracking candidates  

- One example of a hiring or interview coordination workflow you’ve managed (what tools you used, number of candidates, and how you kept things organized)  



Optional but appreciated:



- A 1–2 minute voice or video introduction (link) sharing your background and why you’re a fit for this role  



Use the
 subject line:  

“HR Virtual Assistant / Interview Coordinator – Core Mind Technology – [Your Full Name]”



If you tell me whether you prefer to pay hourly or monthly and your exact target range, I can quickly adjust the compensation section to match your final offer.



Sources

title: Project Scheduler & Subcontractor Coordinator | Low Voltage Security
description:
SynergizeX Inc. is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Project Scheduler & Subcontractor Coordinator to support multiple low-voltage security projects across North America.



This role is ideal for someone with strong hands-on experience building and managing Gantt charts, coordinating multi-site construction schedules, and maintaining clear, proactive communication with field teams, subcontractors, and internal stakeholders.



You will be responsible for maintaining accurate project timelines, aligning field resources, recruiting and coordinating subcontractors, and ensuring smooth execution across active job sites.



Key Responsibilities:

• Scheduling & Planning

• Build and maintain detailed Gantt charts for multiple concurrent projects

• Develop baseline schedules and update progress weekly

• Track milestones, dependencies, labor allocation, and critical paths

• Adjust schedules based on field updates, material delays, or scope changes

• Identify risks to timelines and escalate issues proactively



Site & Field Coordination:

• Coordinate technicians and subcontractors across multiple job sites

• Align installation schedules with site access, material delivery, and trade sequencing

• Maintain consistent communication with site contacts and internal teams

• Ensure field crews are informed of scope, constraints, and priorities

• Track completion status and confirm closeout readiness



Subcontractor Recruitment & Management:

• Source and recruit qualified low-voltage subcontractors across North America

• Pre-qualify subcontractors based on technical capability, licensing, and project experience

• Maintain an organized database of vetted subcontractors

• Coordinate onboarding documentation and compliance requirements

• Align subcontractor availability with active and upcoming project schedules



Communication & Reporting:

• Provide structured weekly schedule updates to leadership and project teams

• Maintain organized documentation of schedule revisions and site updates

• Track open items, action steps, and resource conflicts

• Communicate schedule impacts clearly and professionally



What Success Looks Like:

• Clean, accurate Gantt charts with clearly defined milestones and dependencies

• Field teams and subcontractors deployed efficiently with minimal scheduling conflicts

• Subcontractor capacity aligned with project demand

• Clear communication between internal teams, subcontractors, and clients

• Projects move forward without preventable delays caused by coordination gaps



Required Qualifications:

• 3+ years of experience in project scheduling, construction coordination, or low-voltage/security environments

• Strong hands-on experience creating and managing Gantt charts

• Experience coordinating multiple job sites and trade schedules

• Confident written and verbal communication skills

• Ability to manage shifting priorities and time-sensitive coordination

• Strong organizational discipline and documentation habits

• Proficiency in tools such as Smartsheet, MS Project, Monday, Asana, or similar scheduling platforms

• Reliable internet and professional remote workspace



Preferred Experience:

• Experience in access control, CCTV, structured cabling, or low-voltage installation environments

• Experience recruiting and managing subcontractor networks

• Ability to read construction drawings and interpret scope documents

• Experience supporting multi-state or multi-province field operations



Work Schedule:

• Full-time position with required overlap during Eastern Time business hours

• Occasional early or late calls may be required for site coordination



If you are schedule-driven, detail-focused, and comfortable coordinating subcontractors and field operations in a fast-paced construction environment, we encourage you to apply and join SynergizeX Inc.

About Us

Olowalu Dog Ranch is a premium dog boarding, day camp, and training ranch on Maui, Hawaii. We specialize in free-range play, River Adventure Hikes, structured training, and selective high-ticket board & train programs.

This is a real, physical business with staff, dogs, and daily operations. The priority is calm, reliable systems first — then efficient growth.

Role Overview (Read Carefully)

This is an operations-first role with a clearly defined transition into growth execution.

Phase 1: Stabilize and streamline operations so nothing falls through the cracks.

Phase 2: Once systems are calm and approved, take over Meta ads, basic social posting, and local SEO support for low-commitment services.

Growth is the destination — not the starting point.

Tools You’ll Work With

• Gingr – boarding, day camp, memberships, vaccination tracking

• Wix – training and assessment pages

• Google Sheets / Docs – tracking and SOPs

• Zapier – light automation (when approved)

• Meta Business Manager – later phase (ads)

• Instagram /
 – basic posting

• Google Business Profile – local SEO basics

Responsibilities

Phase 1: Operations Stabilization (First 2–4 Weeks)

• Build and maintain a clear lead tracker

• Set up follow-up workflows and reminders

• Clean calendars and booking confirmations

• Document intake SOPs (meet & greets, assessments, board & train referral path)

• Reduce manual work and staff confusion

• Prepare growth infrastructure without launching:

•  Meta pixel installation

•  Audience setup

•  Creative organization

•  Google Business Profile audit?(No ads, no posting, no spend yet)

Phase 2: Growth Execution (After Approval)

• Launch and manage efficient Meta ads for:

•  $50 meet & greets

•  $150 training assessments

•  Boarding / day camp awareness

•  (Local Maui/Hawaii focus, A/B creatives, monitor CPL/lead quality)?• Nurture leads toward high-ticket board & train (invite-only via owner consults)?• Handle basic Instagram/Facebook posting (scheduling, captions, Canva)?• Support local SEO basics:

•  Google Business Profile optimization

•  Review encouragement workflows

•  Citation consistency?• Provide simple weekly performance summaries

Authority & Boundaries (Non-Negotiable)

You may independently implement operational improvements that:

• reduce steps

• reduce manual work

• simplify staff workload

You may NOT change or implement:

• pricing or rates

• memberships

• packages or discounts

• policies affecting revenue or client expectations

Any change touching pricing, revenue, or policies must be:

Documented ? Recommended ? Approved before implementation

Growth execution (ads/social/SEO) begins only after Phase 1 is complete and approved.

Required Experience

• Operations/process streamlining for small businesses

• Meta/Facebook ads for local service businesses (lead gen, pixel, audiences)

• Basic social media management

• Local SEO fundamentals (Google Business Profile, reviews, citations)

• Detail-oriented, calm, and reliable

• Strong written English

Nice to Have

• Pet or local service business experience

• Canva and Zapier familiarity

• Gingr or Wix experience

How to Apply

Please include:

1.  Resume or brief work history

2.  Meta ads examples (screenshots/results, typical CPL for local services)

3.  Short answer: “How do you approach fixing operations before turning on ads?”

4.  Brief note on local SEO / Google Business Profile experience

5.  Availability and time zone

Shortlisted applicants will complete a paid test task.

Important Note

We value clarity, follow-through, and calm execution over speed or hype.

This is ready to post. It balances everything we discussed: ops-first, clear sequencing, high-ticket nurturing, ad/social/SEO efficiency, and authority protection.

title: Webflow Web Designer
description:
ABOUT THE PROJECT



We are seeking a skilled Webflow designer to build a sophisticated personal website for an entrepreneur operating in the luxury travel and private security space. The site will serve as a professional digital presence for the founder of two businesses.



The website should convey exclusivity, discretion, and credibility - tailored to a mixed audience of potential clients, media, and professional contacts.



SCOPE OF WORK

•  Design and build a complete personal website in Webflow

•  Create smooth scroll animations, a subtle page loader, and refined micro-interactions

•  Ensure the site is fully responsive across desktop, tablet, and mobile

•  Integrate CMS where appropriate (e.g., press features, media mentions)

•  Optimise site speed, SEO basics, and accessibility

•  Deliver a clean, well-structured Webflow project ready for handoff or ongoing management



REQUIREMENTS

•  Proven experience building high-quality websites in Webflow (portfolio required)

•  Strong eye for luxury/editorial design — share examples of similar projects

•  Understanding of Webflow CMS, interactions, and animations

•  Responsive design expertise across all breakpoints

•  Excellent communication and ability to work independently with minimal oversight

•  Comfortable working with a client in a different time zone (Latin America)



NICE TO HAVE

•  Experience designing for luxury brands

•  Familiarity with Webflow hosting, domain setup, and DNS configuration

•  Motion design skills (Lottie animations, advanced Webflow interactions)

•  Basic copywriting or content layout instincts



HOW TO APPLY

Please submit the following:

•  Your portfolio or link to 3–5 relevant Webflow projects

•  A brief note on your approach to building luxury/editorial-style websites

•  Your availability, estimated timeline, and rate (fixed project fee preferred)

•  Any questions you have about the project



This is a one-time project with potential for ongoing collaboration.

Only serious, experienced Webflow designers need apply.

title: Amazon FBA Seller Central Marketing Analyst / Manager / Specialist
description:
Amazon FBA Seller Central Marketing Analyst / Manager / Specialist



+4 Years Amazon Experience Required



This is a unique opportunity for an organized and entrepreneurially-minded Amazon Manager to join our team and help operate and grow startup and household name client brands. As an Amazon Manager, you will be ideating and executing growth strategies while optimizing the Amazon presence of our rapidly growing portfolio of client products and brands.



This is a full time remote role.



What you’ll be doing:



Playing an integral role in designing and building a best-in-class Amazon presence for a set of companies from our diverse brand portfolio.



Creating and continually optimizing listings, as well as troubleshooting and fixing issues as they arise.



Developing marketing strategies across our portfolio of brands, and coordinating with stakeholders as needed to execute.



Managing promotions (coupons, deals) and PPC advertising campaigns.



Analyzing Amazon data (sales, conversation rate, sessions, etc.) to determine why certain products are trending up or down and developing strategies to increase conversions and sales.



Resolving issues that come up (listing take downs, content not publishing, catalog errors, etc.) and escalating to internal stakeholders as needed.



Developing and maintaining a professional knowledge of new or emerging trends within the Amazon and online shopping space. You’ll constantly research opportunities for improvement to drive traffic and conversion growth.





Attending weekly meetings to communicate needs and resolve issues.





Your profile / Must Have:



In-depth knowledge of Amazon Seller Central and FBA processes. +4 Years experience with a track record of success.

Comprehensive understanding of Amazon and Seller Central, best practices, along with policies and guidelines. Flat file expert.



Proven experience as an Amazon Virtual Assistant or in a similar role.

Experience in Amazon detail page optimization, listing management, SEO marketing, and PPC

Excellent organizational and analytical skills, as well as a hands-on mentality.

Excellent communications and customer service skills

Excellent English (speaking and writing)

Creative thinker



Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions. Top notch problem solving skills.



Attention to detail. Self-motivated and able to work independently.

Good with Excel, Google Sheets, and formulas

Proficient in using Google Drive for collaborative tasks.





Nice to Have



Experience with graphic design / photoshop or similar software



Experience with social media marketing



Experience with Walmart Seller Central





About us

We are a full-service agency that works with brands and manufactures to grow their sales and profit on Amazon both in the US and globally. Additionally, we own a handful of private label brands that we own and operate ourselves.

This is a remote position, and candidates from all locations are welcome to apply. We offer flexible working hours and opportunities for professional growth within our organization.



To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this position. We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: AI Video Editor & B-Roll Specialist (Veo 3 & Kling 2.6 Mastery)
description:
We are an E-commerce brand looking for a top-tier AI Video Editor who can bridge the gap between traditional UGC (User Generated Content) and high-end Generative AI.



We need someone who doesn’t just "search" for B-roll, but creates it. You will be responsible for taking our VSL (Video Sales Letter) scripts and generating custom B-roll using the latest AI models to ensure our ads look professional, unique, and high-converting.



Key Responsibilities

AI Video Generation: Create hyper-realistic B-roll clips using Google Veo 3 and Kling 2.6.



VSL Enhancement: Supplement our raw UGC footage with AI-generated scenes that emphasize product benefits and emotional "hooks."



Prompt Engineering: Use Gemini to brainstorm visual metaphors and write technical prompts for video generation.



Audio/Visual Sync: Use Kling’s native audio features to ensure B-roll sound effects match the motion perfectly.



Character Consistency: Ensure that AI-generated characters or hands look consistent across the entire video.



Requirements (Must Have)

Direct Experience: You MUST have active experience using Veo 3 and Kling 2.6. Please do not apply if you have only used basic tools like Sora or older Runway models.



Hardware/Access: You must have your own access to these tools or be ready to manage the accounts we provide.



Ecommerce Knowledge: You understand the "fast-cut" style of UGC and VSLs. You know how to make a video "scroll-stopping."



English Proficiency: Ability to follow complex scripts and technical prompt instructions in English.



Mandatory Portfolio Requirement

Applications without a portfolio will be ignored. Please provide a link to a folder or reel showing:



Direct AI Video Work: Specifically clips generated with Veo or Kling.



Comparison: A "Before/After" or a finished VSL where you used AI B-roll to improve the original footage.



Prompt Example: One example of a prompt you wrote and the video it produced.



How to Apply

Change the Subject Line to: "AI Video Master - [Your Name]"



Include the link to your portfolio.



List the AI video tools you are currently subscribed to or have the most experience with.

title: Real estate admin
description:
Role Overview

The role focuses on identifying and contacting owners of existing HMOs with the aim of sourcing off?market or pre?market acquisition opportunities. The assistant will work primarily through HMO licensing databases, council records, and other publicly available sources to build accurate lead lists and initiate first contact with landlords. The goal is to help secure properties that already hold HMO status, removing the risks associated with planning permission, Article 4 restrictions, and change?of?use applications.

Key Responsibilities

•  Search and extract data from local authority HMO registers, licensing databases, and other public records to identify suitable existing HMOs.

•  Compile and maintain lead lists including landlord names, contact details, property addresses, licence status, and any relevant notes.

•  Conduct outreach to landlords via
, phone, or messaging platforms to introduce the company, gauge interest in selling, and arrange follow?up conversations.

•  Track all communication in a structured CRM or spreadsheet, ensuring accurate notes, dates, and outcomes.

•  Pre?qualify opportunities by gathering basic information on property condition, tenancy status, rental income, and landlord motivation.

•  Monitor changes in HMO licensing data and flag new opportunities as they appear.

•  Support negotiation preparation by providing background research on properties, comparable sales, and local market conditions.

•  Handle sensitive information with confidentiality and professionalism at all times.

Skills & Experience

•  Strong research skills and the ability to navigate council databases and public records.

•  Excellent written and verbal communication, especially for professional outreach.

•  Comfortable making cold or warm contact with landlords and property owners.

•  Highly organised, with experience using spreadsheets or CRM tools.

•  Ability to work independently, follow processes, and meet weekly targets.

•  Prior experience in property sourcing, lettings, acquisitions, or virtual assistance is beneficial but not essential.

Personal Qualities

•  Persistent and proactive in following up leads.

•  Detail?oriented, especially when handling data.

•  Professional, polite, and confident when speaking with landlords.

•  Motivated by results and comfortable working to KPIs.

Working Hours & Structure

•  Remote, flexible working.

•  Part?time or full?time depending on availability and performance.

•  Weekly reporting on leads generated, contacts made, and opportunities identified.

Purpose of the Role

This position directly supports the acquisition strategy of purchasing existing HMOs, allowing the business to bypass planning risk, Article 4 restrictions, and delays associated with change?of?use applications. The assistant plays a key role in sourcing compliant, income?producing properties that can be purchased quickly and efficiently.

title: Real Estate Operations & Client Success Manager – New York
description:
We are hiring an Operations & Client Success Manager who wants to grow with the team for the next 5–10 years.

***IMMEDIATE SALARY INCREASE POSSIBLE- BASED ON YOUR EXPERIENCE ****



Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term Role

9AM–5PM EST (Monday–Friday) | Immediate Start Required



This is a systems and revenue protection role.



Must have experience serving in an operator-level role.



You will support a fast-paced, high-performance New York real estate business that values ownership, initiative, and precision.



===================

About the Role



This position is responsible for protecting deal flow, strengthening systems, and ensuring operational excellence across the business.



You will work directly alongside a fast-moving New York producer who expects clarity, responsiveness, and strong execution.



Daniel is fair and clear. 

He values people who capture instructions once and execute accurately.



===================



Your Responsibilities Will Include: 



• CRM strategy and pipeline flow



• Executive-level reporting and structured summaries



• Revenue risk monitoring



• Listing performance tracking



• Operational system design and improvement



• Client confidence and retention processes



• Identifying bottlenecks before they impact deals



• Real-time responsiveness when priorities shift



• Adapting systems as market conditions evolve



This role requires flexibility, ownership, and long-term thinking.



===================



Important Role Note



New York real estate moves quickly.



While core responsibilities are outlined above, additional operational priorities may arise as the business evolves.



Candidates must be comfortable adapting and taking ownership of new responsibilities aligned with business growth.



===================



Schedule



• Monday–Friday



• 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST



• Immediate start required



• Long-term commitment



===================

Compensation



• Pay increase after consistent demonstration of high performance (at full time)

• 13th Month Pay eligibility (after 12 months full time)

• Structured growth path

• Long-term stability

• Performance-based bonuses



===================

Operations Assessment (Required Assignment)  



Reminder: Daniel runs a high volume, fast-moving real estate business. 

He is looking for a candidate who will ideally be a fit for the next 5-10 years. 



His team will evaluate all submissions carefully.



Only the top 5 candidates will meet with Daniel directly via Zoom.



=====================

Initial Application Questions (Required)



Please answer the following three questions directly in your application.



1. Why are you a strong fit for this Operations & Client Success Manager role?



Be specific. Avoid general traits like “hardworking” or “organized.”



Explain how your experience aligns with protecting revenue and running systems.



2. What operator-level experience do you have?



Describe specific roles where you:



Managed systems



Set priorities



Protected deal flow or revenue



Made independent decisions



List the business type and your level of authority.



3. Revenue Protection Example



Describe one time you protected revenue or prevented a financial loss in a business.



Include:



• What was at risk

• What would have happened if no one acted

• The decision you made

• The measurable outcome



Specific examples only.

============================



Application Instruction (Required)



First line of your response must read exactly:

• OPERATIONS MANAGER – I HAVE EXPERIENCE



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.

All 3 Questions must be answered.



==========================



We look forward to a long term WIN- WIN working relationship.

title: Senior Sales Rep (Real Estate)
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Sales Representative to join our team. The ideal candidate is results-driven, confident in building strong client relationships, and skilled in closing high-value deals. This role offers unlimited earning potential, with a 10% commission on all revenue generated, providing a significant opportunity for financial growth.



Key Responsibilities



Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve and exceed revenue targets.



Identify, pursue, and close new business opportunities.



Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, partners, and key stakeholders.



Conduct presentations, product/service demonstrations, and client consultations.



Manage the full sales cycle from lead generation to contract execution.



Maintain accurate sales activity records and reporting.



Collaborate with internal teams (operations, finance, customer service) to ensure a seamless client experience.



Stay informed on industry trends, competitive landscapes, and market conditions.



Qualifications



3–5+ years of proven sales experience; B2B experience preferred.



Strong track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.



Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.



Ability to work independently while managing multiple priorities.



Self-motivated, driven, and goal-oriented.



Experience in [insert industry if applicable] is a plus.



Compensation & Benefits



10% commission on all revenue generated — no cap on income.



Competitive base pay.



Performance bonuses and incentives.



Flexible scheduling and potential remote work options.



Opportunities for career advancement and professional development.



Why Join Us?



Unlimited earning potential.



Supportive team environment with strong operational backing.



Opportunity to grow with a rapidly expanding company.



Autonomy to manage your book of business and build long-term client relationships.

title: Rockstar Paralegal Assistant
description:
We are seeking a meticulous, tech-savvy Virtual Legal Assistant to serve as the backbone of our digital organization. Your primary mission will be to ensure that every client file is complete, every data point is accurate, and our case management system reflects the current status of every matter. This is a remote, full-time position requiring extreme attention to detail and a "measure twice, cut once" mentality. Also - we are one big team looking for a long term hire to grow with us. You will be part of our team and we will meet with you regularly by zoom, with camera turned on because we want to maintain human connection with all tea
mbers.



Key Responsibilities:



Data Entry/Organization: Inputting sensitive client information into our case management software with accuracy. Names, addresses. You will make sure this information is entered in multiple places. You will review scanned documents and you will interpret from those documents where certain information should be entered.



Digital File Architecture: Organizing and maintaining cloud-based client folders (e.g., Dropbox) according to our firm’s specific naming conventions and structure.



Workflow Tracking: Updating project milestones and deadlines to ensure no client file "stalls" during the drafting or funding process. We are doing all of the work - you will help us make sure the current status of the matter is always correctly documented.



SOPs: You will create the SOPs for your own job. We will give you instructions and guidelines, but you will also create your own SOPs for how you approach the work.



AI Image Generation: You will help us format marketing materials, help us create AI educational images, etc. You will help us with Canva materials as well.



Legacy Data Cleanup: Assisting with the migration or reorganization of older files into our current streamlined system.



Qualifications & Skills:



Legal Experience: 2+ years as a legal assistant or paralegal (Estate Planning experience is a significant plus).



Software Mastery: Proficiency with legal case management software (e.g., Clio, MyCase, or Smokeball) and secure cloud storage systems.



Data Integrity: A proven track record of handling high-volume data entry with zero-to-minimal error rates.



Technical Setup: Must have a secure, high-speed internet connection and a dedicated, quiet workspace that complies with client confidentiality (NDAs will be required).



Reliability: You are someone who values "rugged" reliability—you show up, do the work to a high standard, and don't require micro-management once a process is set.



How to Apply:



Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter. In your letter, please mention one specific tool or method you use to double-check your own work for data entry errors.

title: Senior Copy Strategist for a Injury law firm
description:
Job: 

1. Copywriting is front and center — responsibilities are split into two tiers: Primary (60–70% of time) covers all writing duties, and Secondary (30–40%) covers SEO and digital presence work and website updates/security.



2. No Google Ads - the focus will be on everything else.



3. Qualifications emphasize writing ability and published content alongside SEO skills, rather than treating them as equals.





Application Requirements:  

A. High proficiency in reading/writing in English.  



B. Write a sample piece of content for my firm.  Choose one of the following: (a) a
word draft of a practice area page for one of our services, or (b) an outline and opening 3-4 paragraphs of a blog post targeting a keyword relevant to our practice areas.



C. Include a brief note explaining: which keyword(s) you are targeting, why you chose this topic, what search intent you are addressing, and how this piece would fit into a larger content strategy.



D. Certifications & Tool Proficiency: List all relevant certifications and include copies or links to verify.



E. indicate which SEO, content, and analytics tools you use regularly and your proficiency level with each.







References: ?







Zoom call & Application Review: Walk me  through your case studies, explain your content strategy approach, discuss what you wrote for the sample assignment, and show me how you would approach our firm's content from scratch.  Additional bonuses will apply if you are qualified for this job.  I can contract to that depending on your skill.  I am also OPEN to salary negotiations at the interview  I am on EST time zone. I am available for the next 5-8 hours for interview.

title: Account Management Virtual Assistant
description:
We’re Not Hiring an “Expert.” We’re Hiring Someone Reliable Who Follows Through.

(PLEASE DO NOT REPLY DIRECTLY TO THIS POST. IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO APPLY, FOLLOW THE STEPS AT THE END.)



Pay: Negotiable flat rate per 2-week period (USD), based on experience

Pay Timing: Paid once every 2 weeks. 80 hours per period, agreed upon at hire

Location: Remote (Philippines-based applicants only)

Role Type: Full-time | Long-term

Team Scope: Supports Account Managers across onboarding and client communications



Why This Role Exists

Great client experiences don’t happen because someone talks more.

They happen because someone makes sure nothing gets missed.



At Black Hat Strategy, onboarding sets the tone for the entire client relationship. When steps are skipped, delayed, or not followed up on, problems show up later as confusion or frustration.

We’re hiring an Account Management Virtual Assistant to support our Account Managers by ensuring:



Every onboarding step is completed

Every client request is acknowledged

Every Slack channel is monitored and followed up

Every detail is handled on time and to standard



You do not need prior account management experience.



You need:

The ability to learn processes

Strong follow-up habits

Clear written communication

Attention to detail



This role exists so:

Account Managers can focus on relationships and strategy

Clients feel supported and informed

Onboarding moves forward smoothly without bottlenecks



This is not a reactive support role.

This is a process ownership role.



What You’ll Actually Be Doing

You will not be improvising.

You will be working inside a clear system.

As an Account Management Virtual Assistant, you will:

Support Account Managers during client onboarding

Track onboarding tasks and deadlines inside ClickUp

Ensure all onboarding requirements are completed fully and on time

Monitor client Slack channels daily for messages, questions, or follow-ups

Make sure client requests are acknowledged and routed correctly

Follow up on open items until they are resolved or completed

Maintain high-quality documentation and task updates

Flag risks, delays, or missing information early



You are not expected to manage client strategy.

You are expected to keep the process tight.



This Role Is for Someone Who…

Is highly organized and detail-oriented

Enjoys checklists and structured workflows

Has experience as a Virtual Assistant, Admin Assistant, or Support role (helpful but not required)

Communicates clearly and professionally in writing

Follows processes without cutting corners

Takes pride in doing things right the first time



You don’t need to be an Account Manager.

You do need to be reliable, focused, and disciplined.



How You’ll Work With the Team

Account Managers own relationships… you ensure execution and follow-through

Project Manager enforces timelines… you keep onboarding tasks accurate and updated

Media Buyers and Specialists need clean handoffs… you help make that possible

Ops Head sets standards… you help uphold them daily



You are not operating alone.

You are part of a system.



Why You’ll Like Working Here

Clear responsibilities and expectations

Structured onboarding and workflows

No chaos, no guessing

Leadership that values organization and reliability

Long-term role with room to grow into Account Management



We don’t reward noise.

We reward follow-through.



Application Process

PLEASE DO NOT JUST REPLY TO THIS POST ON THE JOB BOARD.

To be considered, you must complete ALL STEPS BELOW.

The Google Form is your Online Interview.



Step 1: Take a short online IQ test



We respect intelligence and we think you probably do too.

Go to the Fast Learner Free IQ Test and complete it

Create a free account at the end

Save the results URL for Step 3

?? Applicants without a valid link will not be considered



Step 2: Record a 2–3 minute Loom video (camera ON)



Create a free account at Loom

Speak clearly in English

Tell us:

Your paid media experience

How you think about optimization and ROAS

How you’ve helped others improve performance

Save the Loom URL for Step 3



Step 3: Complete the Online Interview



NO AI ALLOWED. We want to hear you.

Open the Application Form

Enter your contact details

Paste:

IQ test results link

Loom video link

Answer all questions honestly and thoughtfully

Your answers matter more than perfect formatting.



Step 4: Live Video Interview (camera on)



This is where we get to know how you think.

I personally review every candidate who completes the steps above and will reach out directly to those who feel like the right fit.

If this role speaks to you, good.

That means you’re probably the kind of person we’re looking for.



Bring your best.

We’ll bring the system.



Link to Online Interview Form:

description:
We’re Not Hiring “Ad Experts.” We’re Hiring People Who Learn Fast and Execute Cleanly.

(PLEASE DO NOT REPLY DIRECTLY TO THIS POST. IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO APPLY, FOLLOW THE STEPS AT THE END.)

Why This Role Exists

Meta Ads rewards discipline, not guessing.

At Black Hat Strategy, performance doesn’t come from hacks or shortcuts. It comes from interpreting signals correctly, following systems, and making fewer — better — decisions.



We’re hiring five Media Buyers to execute inside a proven framework. Prior ad experience is helpful, but not required. What matters more is your ability to think analytically, follow process, and learn quickly.



This role exists so:

Campaigns are managed consistently

Budgets are paced correctly

Creative tests are structured, not random

Performance changes are interpreted before actions are taken



This is not a “figure it out as you go” role.

This is a learn fast, execute clean role.

You will not be left guessing.

You will be trained and supported.



As a Media Buyer, you will:

Manage Meta ad accounts for ecommerce brands

Launch and maintain campaigns using predefined structures

Monitor performance signals and pacing daily

Make changes only when signals justify it

Document actions and observations inside ClickUp

Flag issues early instead of reacting late

Escalate when something truly feels off — not every dip

Can follow processes without cutting corners

You don’t need to be a media buying “expert.”

Ops Head sets direction… you stay aligned and consistent



You are not operating alone.

You are part of a system.



Why You’ll Like Working Here

No chaos, no guessing

title: Sales/Admin  U.S.
description:
Sales-Focused Virtual Assistant (Strong Closer with Admin Skills) – U.S. Cleaning Business



We are hiring a Sales-Oriented Virtual Assistant who knows how to confidently handle

objections and close deals over the phone. You’ll be the first point of contact for leads

interested in our U.S.-based cleaning services, and your main goal is to convert those inquiries

into paying customers.



This role is ideal for someone who thrives in sales conversations, knows how to build trust

quickly, and doesn’t shy away from tough questions or hesitations from prospects.



Key Responsibilities:

? Take inbound sales calls from interested leads and follow up with outbound calls when

needed

? Confidently pitch our services and walk customers through pricing and packages

? Handle common objections (pricing, scheduling, trust concerns) with professionalism

and ease

? Convert warm leads into scheduled jobs with a consistent close rate

? Manage CRM updates, lead tracking, and post-call notes

Thanks for your time.
