title: Media Buyer - Meta Ads Lead Generation Specialist
description:
Accelereight is an AI and automation consulting firm helping service-based businesses implement scalable AI systems inside their operations.



We serve founder-led agencies and service businesses. Our services are high-ticket and performance-driven.



We are hiring a Meta Ads Lead Generation Specialist based in the Philippines to help us generate qualified booked calls.



This is not an ecommerce role.



Your primary objective:

Generate qualified booked calls from service business owners using Meta ads.



What You’ll Own



Launch and manage Meta lead generation campaigns



Optimize for cost per qualified booked call



Improve click-to-booking conversion rates



Test creatives and targeting aligned with our ICP



Provide weekly performance reporting and insights



Collaborate directly with the founder on performance improvements



You will be evaluated on pipeline impact, not vanity metrics.



Ideal Candidate



2+ years running Meta ads



Experience generating booked calls for service businesses



Understands high-ticket lead funnels



Comfortable being accountable to performance



Clear communicator with strong written English



Compensation



$6–$12 per hour depending on experience



3% revenue share on deals closed fro
ta-generated leads



Revenue share applies only to revenue directly attributed to Meta campaigns.



Compensation increases with performance.



Application Requirements (Mandatory)



To be considered, you must complete the following:



1. Submit a 5–10 Minute Loom Video



In your Loom, please walk through:



A Meta campaign you personally managed



The objective of the campaign



Budget range



Cost per lead and cost per booked call



What was not working initially



What you changed to improve results



Final outcome



We are evaluating clarity of thinking, not just results.



2. Complete the Performance Framework Below



Please answer the following in writing:



A. Lead Quality Strategy

If we are targeting service business owners doing $1M–$20M annually, how would you structure targeting and qualification to reduce low-quality leads?



B. Funnel Optimization

If clicks are high but booked calls are low, what are the first three things you would audit?



C. Cost Control

If cost per booked call increases 40% month over month, how do you diagnose the issue?



D. Scaling

If campaigns are performing profitably, how do you scale without destroying efficiency?



Applications that do not include Loom + written responses will not be reviewed.

title: Construction Accounting
description:
We’re hiring a Project Accountant to support construction, loan, and compliance operations across multiple affordable housing developments. If you’re detail-driven, good with documentation, and like work that has real impact, this is a strong long-term fit.



Why You’ll Love This Role



You will work directly with decision-makers — your work will be visible and valued.

You will help keep projects compliant, funded, and on schedule.

No bureaucracy, no busywork — your work directly moves projects forward.

Real room to grow into senior financial coordination or project support.



Your Typical Day

Organize and maintain project financial and compliance documentation.

Support the preparation of monthly construction draw requests.

Communicate with contractors to collect invoices, lien waivers, and documents.

Update budgets, change order logs, and payment tracking sheets.

Coordinate with lenders, accounting, and project managers as needed.



What You’ll Be Doing



1) Loan & Draw Support

Compile lien waivers, invoices, schedules, and supporting docs for draw packages.

Compare cost reports to contracts, change orders, and lender requirements.

Track soft costs (architect, engineering, inspections, interest, title, etc.).

Prepare clear, organized submission files for lenders.



2) Construction Financial Administration

Maintain digital project files (contracts, pay apps, insurance, permits, payrolls).

Track executed change orders against pay apps and budgets.

Monitor buyout logs, completion schedules, and compliance documents.

Follow up with contractors until documentation is accurate and complete.



3) General Coordination & Reporting

Maintain trackers, logs, and internal reports.

Prepare agendas, notes, and status reports for project meetings.

Communicate professionally with internal and external stakeholders.

Handle confidential financial data with discretion.



What We’re Looking For

2–4+ years in project accounting, construction admin, or loan/draw processing.

Familiarity with construction draws, budgets, or lender compliance preferred.

Proficiency in Excel and document management tools (Procore/Built/Buildertrend a bonus).

Extremely organized, detail-accurate, and accountable to deadlines.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Experience working for a US construction company or real-estate developer



Nice to Have

Experience in real estate development or affordable housing.

Knowledge of construction accounting.

Experience with billing using AIA G702/G703 forms.

Degree in Accounting, Construction Mgmt, Business, or related field.



TO APPLY: send a recording via 
 and answer these questions:

1.) What struck your interest about the role?

2.) Tell me about your experience in construction accounting?



SUBJECT: Construction Accounting - YOUR NAME



About Us



Atrium Housing is a mission-driven affordable housing developer with an affiliated construction company with offices in Louisiana, Florida and Texas. We don’t just build buildings — we create opportunities for families and communities. Our finance and construction teams work with lenders, contractors, and public partners to move projects from concept to completion.

title: Finance Analyst/ Account Analyst
description:
Atrium Housing is a mission-driven real estate development firm focused on creating affordable housing and vibrant communities. Our projects span mixed-finance and LIHTC transactions, and we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, impactful housing solutions while fostering a collaborative, supportive, and growth-oriented work environment.



At Atrium, you’ll have the opportunity to learn directly from experienced development professionals, work on meaningful projects that impact communities, and build a strong foundation for a career in real estate finance and affordable housing development.



Role Purpose



As a Development Analyst, you’ll support affordable housing transactions through financial underwriting, due diligence coordination, and application support. While LIHTC experience is a plus, it is not required—what matters most is your analytical mindset, attention to detail, and eagerness to learn.



Primary Value You’ll Bring:



* Accurate underwriting and financial modeling

* Organized and reliable diligence tracking

* High-quality application support for housing agencies, investors, and lenders



What You’ll Do



* Build and maintain detailed financial models and sources-and-uses statements (LIHTC exposure is a bonus)

* Prepare rent schedules, operating pro formas, and subsidy layering analyses

* Support preparation of state housing agency applications

* Coordinate third-party reports such as market studies, appraisals, environmental studies, and surveys

* Maintain due diligence and closing checklists

* Assist with investor, lender, and internal memos



What We’re Looking For

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Primary Responsibilities

1. Project Control & Zoho Governance

Meeting Shadowing: Attend all internal, client, and sales meetings. Capture all action items and deadlines in real-time.



Task Translation: Convert the CEO’s verbal ideas and voice notes into structured project plans within Zoho Projects.



The "Monday Pulse": Run weekly audits of all active projects. Identify bottlenecks and hold Directors (and the CEO) accountable for overdue tasks.



Reporting: Generate weekly performance and KPI reports for the CEO to review business health at a glance.



2. Sales & CRM Management

Pipeline Hygiene: Manage Zoho CRM to ensure every lead has a clear "Next Step" and follow-up date.



Contract Administration: Draft and send contracts (via Zoho Sign) following verbal closes and manage the signature process.



Client Onboarding: Coordinate the transition from "Closed-Won" to "Project Kickoff," ensuring Directors are briefed and tasks are assigned.



3. Communications & PR Support

Drafting & Ghostwriting: Draft press releases, client correspondence, and internal announcements based on CEO bullet points.



Media Outreach: Manage media lists and handle the distribution and tracking of press releases.



Inbox & Slack Triage: Act as the first line of defense for the CEO’s communications, filtering for high-priority items and answering routine operational questions.



4. Strategic Calendar Defense

Time Batching: Organize the CEO’s calendar to maximize "Deep Work" time, grouping sales and consulting calls into specific blocks.



Briefings: Provide the CEO with daily "Briefing Notes" including context for upcoming meetings and status updates on pending deliverables.



Daily updates highlighting urgent tasks and prioritizing next day tasks



Required Qualifications

Expert Proficiency in Zoho Suite: Specifically Zoho Projects, Zoho CRM, and Zoho Sign.



Operations Mindset: You enjoy building systems and find "messy" environments satisfying to clean.



Assertiveness: You are comfortable "managing up" and holding a CEO accountable to their own deadlines.



Exceptional Communication: The ability to turn a 60-second frantic voice memo into a professional, multi-step project plan.



Remote Work Fluency: Expert use of Slack, Zoom, Loom, and password management tools (e.g., LastPass/1Password).



Reliability is critical in this role - EST hours



Key Performance Indicators (Success Metrics)

System Integrity: 100% of the CEO's verbal commitments are logged in Zoho within 2 hours of a meeting.



Reporting Consistency: Monday Morning Reports are delivered by 9:00 AM local time without fail.



Lead Capture: Zero sales leads sit in the CRM without an active "Next Action" date.



CEO Throughput: A measurable reduction in the CEO's time spent on administrative "checking in" vs. high-level consulting.



How to Apply

Please include a brief Loom video or cover letter detailing your experience managing a Zoho environment and how you have previously held an executive accountable.

title: Visual Storyteller | Editor
description:
Visual Storyteller | Video Editor (Remote/Hybrid)

About Re:Action



Re:Action is a cinematic brand storytelling agency. We work with ambitious startups and high-growth companies to craft brand films, campaigns, and content systems that clarify their story and drive growth.



We don’t just edit video — we design stories that move people. Now, we’re looking for a Visual Storyteller | Video Editor to join our team and help bring those stories to life.



The Role



As a Visual Storyteller, you’re not just cutting clips — you’re shaping narrative, rhythm, and emotion. You’ll collaborate with our creative team and founder to transform raw footage into cinematic short-form and long-form pieces for websites, campaigns, and social platforms.



Key Responsibilities



Edit short-form videos (30–90 sec) for social (Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, YouTube Shorts).



Edit longer-form content (2–5 min) for brand films, campaigns.



Craft compelling narratives through pacing, music, sound design, and graphics.



Collaborate with the team on creative direction and story structure.



Repurpose existing assets into new content formats while keeping the cinematic feel.



Stay on top of editing trends, motion graphics, and social-first storytelling styles.



What We’re Looking For



Strong portfolio that shows story-driven editing, not just flashy cuts.



Proficiency in DaVinci Resolve (preferred) or Adobe Premiere Pro / After Effects.



Understanding of pacing, rhythm, and storytelling in video.



Ability to integrate graphics, subtitles, and text animations when needed.



Creative eye for detail — color, sound, and mood.



Self-starter who can work independently and meet deadlines.



Bonus: experience editing cinematic commercial work or founder-led content.



Compensation & Commitment



Freelance / Part-Time to start (with option to grow into Full-Time).



Competitive pay depending on experience.



Remote-friendly, with flexible hours as long as deadlines are met.



Opportunity to work on high-end, cinematic campaigns for startups and brands.



How to Apply



Send your CV and portfolio/reel to 
 with the subject line: “Visual Storyteller Application – [Your Name]”.

Include 2–3 examples of your strongest story-driven edits (commercial, brand, or social).

title: Accountant/Bookkeeper
description:
How to Apply:

Complete application here: 



Job Title: Accountant/Bookkeeper

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Schedule: US Business Hours (Full-Time)

Rate: $5.00 – $8.00 USD per hour (depending on experience)



About the Role

We are a US-based Home Services company specializing in Roofing, Solar, Generac, and Spray Foam. We are looking for a detail-oriented CPA to manage our daily accounting, job costing, and payroll. You will be responsible for keeping our QuickBooks Online accurate and ensuring our team is paid on time.



Key Responsibilities

- Job Costing: Categorize material and labor expenses to specific projects (Roofing vs. Solar) to track our profit margins.

- Accounts Payable (AP): Enter vendor invoices into QBO, verify amounts against purchase orders, and prepare payments for approval.

- Accounts Receivable (AR): Monitor customer payments coming in via GoHighLevel (GHL) and reconcile them in QuickBooks.

- Payroll Processing: Prepare weekly/bi-weekly payroll for our US-based employees (W-2/1099) and our international contractors using platforms like Gusto or Wise.

- Reconciliations: Perform weekly bank and credit card reconciliations to ensure the books are "tax-ready" at all times.



Requirements

- License: Must be a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) in the Philippines.

- Experience: Strong experience with QuickBooks Online is required.

- US Standards: Solid understanding of US bookkeeping and payroll basics.

- Technical: Comfortable using GHL (exporting data) and Google Workspace.

- Reliability: Must be able to work during CST business hours with a stable internet connection.

Complete application here:

title: AI Content Creator & Community Manager (US Basketball/Sports)
description:
About Us:

We run a highly scalable social media network based in Australia. Our flagship basketball debate brand, KingVsAir, is rapidly expanding its daily output. We are looking for a hungry, detail-oriented AI Content Creator and Community Manager who lives and breathes US basketball culture and can execute a strict, high-volume content formula.



To succeed in this role, you cannot just be a casual fan. You need a deep, almost encyclopedic knowledge of the NBA, historical matchups, player stats, and the current debate culture to create content that genuinely hooks a hardcore basketball audience and drives massive comment velocity.





The Software You Will Use:



Nano Banana Pro: You will be provided access to generate images via our centralized Higgsfield Team Account so there is no cost to you. All text generation happens natively inside the prompt—no Photoshop or Canva required.



Seedance 2.0 & Topaz: You will generate high-fidelity video motion using Seedance 2.0, and then use Topaz to upscale all final video assets to crisp 4K at 60fps. (Note: Access to these external tools will be provided. Once Seedance 2.0 is available on Higgsfield, we will transition that step into our Team plan).



Google Drive & 
: 
 is our HQ for all communication, concept pitches, and draft reviews (using a simple emoji approval system). Final high-resolution assets are strictly uploaded to our shared Google Drive.





Your Daily Responsibilities:



Content Generation: Generate 5 AI images (Nano Banana Pro) and 6 short-form videos (Seedance 2.0 + Topaz upscaling) daily, strictly following our established text/image debate formulas and visual hooks.



Copywriting: Write highly engaging captions, relevant hashtags, and debate-sparking questions for each post to drive community interaction.



Asset Management: Upload all drafts to designated 
 channels for quick review, then push final approved assets to Google Drive.



Community Management: Act as a moderator for our page via Meta Business Suite. Reply to comments to boost algorithmic engagement, manage our official
 Group, and ensure our lead magnet links (wallpaper packs) are pinned in the comments as soon as posts go live.





What We Are Looking For:



Deep, obsessive knowledge of the NBA, basketball history, and debate topics (e.g., MJ vs. LeBron, peak performances, rings vs. stats). You should be able to spot a flawed basketball argument from a mile away.



Experience with AI image generation, video creation tools, and video upscaling software.



Reliability to hit the 11-post daily quota consistently.



Excellent written English for copywriting and community replies.





Compensation & Perks:



Base Pay: $400 - $500 USD per month ($100 - $125/week), paid weekly via Wise.



Performance Bonus: An end-of-month cash bonus if the page's overall Average View Duration hits our target metrics.



Buffer Time: This is a full-time, 40-hour/week role. The content generation will leave you with healthy buffer time each day to handle moderation, research, and ideation without burning out.





How to Apply:

Please reply with the phrase "Nothing but net" at the top of your application so we know you read the entire post. Include a brief summary of why your favorite NBA team will (or won't) win the championship this year, and link to any previous AI, video editing, or community management work you have done.

title: Customer Service — Inbound Support Specialist
description:
ABOUT AJ MEDIA

At AJ Media, our brands — Gekko Gifts, Purvos, and Besyner — live and die by the customer experience. We need someone who can handle high volumes of inbound support while making every single customer feel like they're our only customer. If you're a problem-solver who takes pride in turning frustrated shoppers into brand evangelists, we want you.



THE OPPORTUNITY

You'll be the first line of defense and the last line of trust for our customers. From order inquiries to returns and escalations, you'll handle it all — with speed, empathy, and an obsession for getting it right.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

Respond to inbound customer inquiries across
, live chat, and social DMs with speed and accuracy

Resolve order issues, shipping delays, returns, exchanges, and billing questions within SLA targets

Proactively turn service interactions into retention 
nts — reduce churn through stellar support

Escalate complex issues appropriately while owning the customer's outcome end-to-end

Maintain a CSAT (Customer Satisfaction Score) of 90%+ consistently

Identify patterns in customer issues and flag recurring problems to the operations team

Keep helpdesk (Gorgias or similar) organized with proper tagging, notes, and follow-up

Contribute to and maintain FAQ, help articles, and support macros



WHO YOU ARE

1–3 years of customer support experience, ideally in an ecommerce or DTC environment

You write with clarity, warmth, and professionalism — even on your toughest days

You handle high-volume queues without losing attention to detail or empathy

You're a natural problem-solver who doesn't wait to be told what to do

You're comfortable with helpdesk tools (Gorgias, Zendesk, or similar), Shopify, and basic CRM

You understand ecommerce logistics: shipping carriers, fulfillment workflows, refund processes



BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE

Experience with Gorgias or ReAmaze specifically

Shopify admin knowledge

Knows how to navigate Aircall



WHY JOIN US

Join a team that genuinely values CS as a growth lever, not a cost center

Performance bonuses tied to CSAT and resolution metrics

Career growth into CS Team Lead or CX Operations roles

Fully remote position with a collaborative, high-ownership culture

Work with exciting consumer brands in a high-growth environment



Sound like you? Apply now with your CV and a video introduction on why you're the right person for this role. We read every application personally. No recruiters, no generic forms — just a real conversation about whether we're a fit.



Apply here:

title: Executive Assistant
description:
EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT (Female only, Full-Time, Remote – Philippines)



Join a mission-driven company empowering women across Asia to live stronger, healthier, and happier lives.

We’re growing fast — and we’re looking for a highly organised, proactive, and loyal Executive Assistant to support our leadership team and keep daily operations running like clockwork.

This is a long-term, full-time position (not freelance) with a company that values your growth, integrity, and professional excellence. 



???? YOUR ROLE



You’ll work directly with our senior leadership team, helping coordinate schedules, manage communications, and streamline key projects.



Your main responsibilities:



* Manage daily schedules, calendars, and appointments

* Handle professional
s — screen, prioritise, and draft replies

* Track projects, tasks, and documentation accurately

* Conduct research and prepare executive reports or presentations

* Coordinate between departments (Ops, Sales, Coaches, HR)

* Assist with HR, onboarding, and internal communications

* Manage travel logistics and event planning (as needed)

* Uphold confidentiality and professionalism at all times



 ???? WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT WORKING WITH US

? Competitive KPI-based pay— reward tied to real performance

? Stable, long-term role — this is a career path, not a gig

? Clear SOPs & structured onboarding to set you up for success

? Supportive leadership that values feedback and transparency

? Collaborative, growth-driven culture — your voice matters here

? Training & development — we invest in your continuous learning

? Respectful, integrity-first workplace



???? YOU’RE A GREAT FIT IF YOU HAVE:



* Excellent English communication skills— written & spoken

* Typing speed of at least 45 WPM

* Strong organisational and problem-solving skills

* Experience with Google Workspace, MS Office, and online tools

* Proactive attitude and impeccable attention to detail

* Reliable internet connection with backup plan

* Quiet, professional home workspace with webcam and lighting

* Prior experience as Executive Assistant / Admin / VA is a plus

* A personality grounded in honesty, initiative, and consistency



???? NOT A GOOD FIT IF YOU:



* Have other part
 work

* Unfamiliar with basic remote work tech set up (google suite, zoom etc)

* Struggle with deadlines or frequent absences

* Need constant reminders or supervision

* Complain when things get challenging instead of problem-solving

* Lack a stable workspace or internet connection



We need someone who shows up, communicates clearly, and takes ownership.



???? WORK HOURS



Tuesday to Saturday, 1:00 PM – 10:00 PM (Singapore time)

This ensures smooth coordination with our Singapore-based team.



???? OUR COMPANY CULTURE



We live by five core values that define everything we do:



* Honesty — tell the truth, always.

* Integrity — deliver with excellence and accuracy.

* Commitment — follow through on your word.

* Growth Mindset — keep learning, keep improving.

* Team Spirit — work with respect, collaboration, and positivity.



???? HOW TO APPLY



Send an
 with the subject line: “Personal Executive Assistant” and include clear answers to ALL of the following:



1?? Why should we hire you? Describe your experience — don’t list it.

2?? Where in the Philippines are you based, and how stable is your power/internet?

3?? What equipment do you use (computer specs, internet speed)?

4?? What’s your plan if there’s a power or internet outage?

5?? Record a short audio intro — share your name, favourite food, and favourite place to visit!

6?? Attach a screenshot of your DISC profile from OnlineJobs.ph.

7?? Take a typing test from 
  and include your screenshot result.



???? READY TO GROW WITH US?



If you’re seeking long-term stability, a positive and structured team culture, and the chance to grow in a meaningful role — we’d love to hear from you.



Apply now and become part of a company that values excellence, growth, and integrity. 



Warm regards

Terry Lim

HR Manager

title: YouTube Growth Specialist (Full Channel Build & Scale)
description:
Remote | Performance-Based Opportunity | Long-Term Role



We are looking for an experienced YouTube Growth Specialist who can build and scale a YouTube channel from scratch into a high-performing, algorithm-optimised asset.



This is NOT just a video editing role.



We want someone who understands YouTube deeply — strategy, psychology, click-through rates, retention curves, thumbnails, packaging, and subscriber growth mechanics.



???? Your Role & Responsibilities



1?? Channel Creation & Branding

- Set up a YouTube channel from scratch

- Design professional channel branding (banner, layout, playlists, positioning)

- Create a visually compelling, high-converting channel structure

- Ensure brand consistency across thumbnails and content



2?? YouTube Algorithm Strategy

Deep understanding of how the YouTube algorithm works



Optimise for:

- Click Through Rate (CTR)

- Audience Retention

- Watch Time

- Session Duration

- Suggested & Browse traffic

- Develop a content packaging strategy to maximise views

- Analyse analytics and continuously improve performance



3?? Video Editing & Library Management

- Edit a large existing library of content

- Repackage older content for YouTube optimisation



Cut long-form content into:

- High-retention main videos

- Shorts

- Clips for repurposing

- Upload consistently with a structured schedule



4?? Upload Optimisation

- Create high-converting thumbnails

- Write algorithm-optimised titles

- Write compelling descriptions

- Add timestamps strategically

- Tag videos correctly

- Create playlist strategies

- Ensure each video is fully optimised for discovery



5?? Channel Growth & Management

Develop a roadmap to:



- Reach high subscriber growth

- Increase monthly views significantly

- Position channel as authority in its niche

- Manage comments and engagement strategy

- Suggest content direction based on analytics



???? Our Goal

We are looking to build a high-volume, high-authority YouTube channel with strong subscriber growth and serious watch time.



This is a long-term growth role for someone who understands how to build a YouTube asset — not just upload content.



? You Must Have

- Proven track record growing at least one YouTube channel

- Evidence of channels you've helped scale

- Strong understanding of YouTube Studio analytics

- Thumbnail creation experience

- SEO & packaging knowledge

- High attention to detail

- Strategic mindset — not just technical skills



???? How To Apply

If you are interested, please reply with:



- Your resume / CV

- Links to YouTube channels you have worked on



A brief explanation of:

- The channel size before you worked on it

- The strategy you implemented

- The results achieved (growth metrics)

- Your monthly availability

- Your expected compensation



?? Important

- Applications without proof of past YouTube growth will not be considered.

- We are looking for someone who understands YouTube at a serious level.

title: Senior HubSpot Sales Operations Manager (CRM Pipelines & Automation)
description:
IMPORTANT – Please Read Before Applying



This is NOT a general virtual assistant role.



We are only interested in applicants with real, hands-on HubSpot CRM experience supporting active sales teams and managing pipelines daily.



If your experience is mainly social media, admin support, or
 marketing, this role will not be a fit.



—-



About The Role



The Door Centre Galway is a fast-growing Irish showroom and joinery business receiving a high daily volume of enquiries through Meta ads, WhatsApp, phone, and website leads.



We are hiring a full-time HubSpot Sales Operations Manager to take ownership of our CRM, lead flow, automation, and sales coordination so our showroom closers can focus on selling.



You will act as the operational controller behind our sales system.



—-



Core Responsibilities



HubSpot CRM Ownership

 • Manage HubSpot daily as the central sales operations platform

 • Maintain pipelines, deal stages, and ownership rules

 • Monitor incoming leads and ensure fast first contact

 • Maintain high data quality and structured CRM processes

 • Prevent duplicate contacts and stale deals



Lead Flow & Coordination

 • Review incoming leads fro
ta ads, website forms, WhatsApp, and calls

 • Send approved WhatsApp/email first-touch messages

 • Qualify enquiries (homeowner vs builder/trade)

 • Assign leads to the correct sales closer

 • Ensure follow-ups are scheduled and completed



Automation & Workflow Management

 • Build and maintain HubSpot workflows, sequences, and task automation

 • Improve response speed and conversion processes

 • Support WhatsApp integration within HubSpot

 • Suggest improvements to our sales systems



Sales Operations Support

 • Identify stalled deals and notify the sales team

 • Track pipeline health and activity

 • Provide simple weekly reporting to management



—-



What This Role Is NOT

 • You will NOT be responsible for closing sales

 • You will NOT negotiate pricing or speak technically about products

 • You will NOT run marketing campaigns or social media



Your focus is CRM operations, lead coordination, and sales structure.



—-



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)

 • Proven hands-on experience managing HubSpot for a sales-driven business

 • Strong understanding of Deals, Contacts, Companies, Pipelines, and Workflows

 • Experience supporting or coordinating active sales teams

 • Ability to manage high lead volumes daily

 • Excellent written English communication skills

 • Able to work independently and take ownership



—-



Preferred Experience

 • WhatsApp integration within a CRM

 • Sales Operations / Revenue Operations background

 • Experience in construction, home improvement, retail, or trade environments



—-



Working Style We Expect

 • Highly organised and process-driven

 • Confident managing systems without constant supervision

 • Ownership mindset — not just task-based

 • Comfortable working aligned with Irish business hours



—-



Compensation



Full-time remote position with competitive salary based on proven HubSpot Sales Operations experience.



Expected range: ph55,000 – ph85,000 per month depending on seniority and hands-on HubSpot expertise.

($1000 - $1500)



This is a long-term role with a growing Irish business — not a short-term VA position.



—-



Application Instructions (Important)



To be considered, please include:

 1. A short Loom/video introduction explaining your HubSpot experience.

 2. Examples of pipelines, workflows, or automation you have personally built.

 3. Confirmation you can work aligned to Irish business hours.

 4. Start your application with the word PIPELINE so we know you have read the full job description.



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Finance Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced Finance Manager, International to lead financial planning and analysis for international markets. This role serves as a key business partner to cross-functional leaders, driving budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and strategic financial insights across global regions.



The ideal candidate combines strong analytical expertise with strategic thinking and the ability to translate financial data into actionable recommendations that support growth and operational efficiency.



Responsibilities:



Lead annual budgeting and monthly forecasting processes for international markets, ensuring alignment with company objectives

Conduct in-depth financial analysis to assess business performance, trends, and growth opportunities

Perform budget-to-actual variance analysis and clearly communicate key drivers to leadership

Develop and maintain financial models to support scenario planning and long-term strategy

Provide decision support to leadership through financial insights and performance analysis

Partner with regional and country leaders to develop and track KPIs

Prepare and present management reports highlighting key financial metrics and trends

Collaborate cross-functionally, including close partnership with Accounting during monthly close cycles

Conduct ad hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives and business decisions

Identify and implement process improvements within FP&A workflows to increase efficiency and accuracy



Requirements:



Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred

4–6 years of FP&A experience

Strong expertise in budgeting, forecasting, variance analysis, and financial modeling

Experience building three-statement financial models and cash flow forecasts is strongly preferred

Proficiency in Excel and financial analysis tools

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and data interpretation skills

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Experience partnering with cross-functional and international stakeholders

Strategic mindset with the ability to convert financial data into business insights

title: Virtual Assistant – Podcast & Light Bookkeeping Support (Part-Time with chance for FT)
description:
A growing U.S.-based Fractional CFO firm specializing in service-based businesses is hiring a part-time Virtual Assistant.



This role focuses on two primary areas:

 1. Podcast guest research and coordination

 2. Light bookkeeping support for select clients



This is a long-term position for someone dependable and detail-oriented.



Hours & Pay

 • 10–20 hours per week to start

 • $5–$8 per hour depending on experience

 • Must overlap at least 3–4 hours daily with U.S. Pacific Time

 • Weekly video check-in required



Primary Responsibilities



1) Podcast Guest Research (High Priority)



The firm produces a weekly podcast focused on business owners in the trades and service industries.



Responsibilities include:

 • Research potential podcast guests in HVAC, plumbing, electrical, and related industries

 • Identify qualified owners, operators, consultants, and industry experts

 • Create short research briefs for internal review

 • Maintain a structured guest pipeline tracker

 • Track episode production and release calendar

 • Deliver short-form video clips to guests after episodes are published

 • Maintain organized folders for transcripts, clips, and media assets



You will not book meetings or manage
 communication. All guest communication is handled internally. Your role is research, preparation, organization, and follow-up tracking.



2) Light Bookkeeping Support (High Priority)



The firm provides CFO services to service-based businesses and requires support with structured bookkeeping tasks.



Responsibilities include:

 • Reconcile bank and credit card accounts in QuickBooks Online

 • Categorize transactions based on defined chart of accounts

 • Match deposits and clear transactions

 • Upload and organize receipts

 • Prepare monthly financial exports for review

 • Flag unusual transactions or balance sheet items for review



You will not make accounting decisions or post journal entries without approval. Your role is preparation and organization. Final review and accounting judgment remain with the CFO.



Secondary Responsibilities (As Needed)

 • Draft show notes from podcast transcripts

 • Identify 8–10 strong short-form video clip timestamps per episode

 • Assist with scheduling podcast uploads

 • Maintain client status dashboards

 • Document and update standard operating procedures

 • Maintain organized internal tracking systems in spreadsheets or Notion



Required Skills

 • Strong written English

 • High attention to detail

 • Experience with QuickBooks Online

 • Comfortable working with spreadsheets

 • Able to follow structured processes

 • Comfortable asking questions when unsure

 • Stable internet connection and quiet workspace



Personality Fit

 • Detail-oriented and precise

 • Dependable and consistent

 • Comfortable working behind the scenes

 • Proactive but does not overstep

 • Willing to follow defined systems



Application Instructions



To apply:

 1. Record a short 2–3 minute Loom video introducing yourself.

 2. Describe your QuickBooks Online experience.

 3. Explain how you would research strong podcast guests in a specific industry.



Begin your application with the words: “Detail matters.”

title: SHOPIFY MANAGER (Senior Level)
description:
We are looking for a performance-driven Shopify Manager to lead our eCommerce operations and small team. This role is responsible for driving sales growth, improving daily operations, identifying gaps, and executing strategies that increase revenue and efficiency.

We need someone who thinks like an owner — proactive, analytical, and results-focused.



Applicants that will not submit resume will be automatically rejected.

AUTOMOTIVE EXPERIENCE IS A PLUS BUT NOT REQUIRED.

New Zealand timings (6 AM PH ONWARDS) (CAN BE FLEXIBLE)



Key Responsibilities

• Manage and optimize our Shopify store for performance and conversions

• Lead and supervise a small team (assign tasks, monitor output, ensure accountability)

• Identify operational gaps and implement improvements

• Analyze sales data to determine:

o What products to push

o What products to remove

o New opportunities to expand the catalog



• Develop and execute strategies to increase sales and conversion rates

• Oversee marketing initiatives (ads,
 campaigns, promotions, product launches)

• Improve customer experience, fulfillment process, and overall workflow

• Monitor KPIs: revenue, conversion rate, AOV, ROAS, customer retention



Requirements

• Proven experience managing a Shopify store

• Experience leading a team

• Background in marketing (paid ads,
 marketing, product positioning)

• Strong understanding of sales funnels and conversion optimization

• Analytical and data-driven decision maker

• Problem-solver with strong operational mindset



Performance Expectations

• Increase monthly revenue

• Improve store conversion rate

• Identify and fix operational inefficiencies

• Build a structured and accountable team environment

• Develop scalable systems for long-term growth

title: AI Developer / AI Solutions Specialist
description:
Job Description:



We are looking for an AI Developer who has a strong interest in understanding how AI tools and technologies work and how they can be applied to real-world business use cases. This role is not focused on heavy coding, but on learning, researching, and helping turn AI ideas into practical solutions.

The ideal candidate will act as a point of contact when new AI concepts, tools, or videos are discovered and assess how they can be realistically implemented in the business.

New Zealand based.

title: Vector Graphic Designer - Position 5
description:
About Us

HouseSensationsArt specializes in creating high-quality, custo
tal signs for homes, businesses, and special events. With over 30 years of experience in sign manufacturing and metal fabrication, we pride ourselves on craftsmanship, attention to detail, and exceptional customer service. We sell across multiple e-commerce platforms and require multiple graphic designers for product development, social media, customer service- providing mockups and fulfillment of orders, and website product development.



We are seeking a versatile Graphic Designer with proven experience in custom laser-cut metal sign design and Amazon A+ content creation to join our Philippines-based design team on a project-based or ongoing basis.  You will join our team of 10+ in-house designers 

You must be able to design and create an original design that is ready for laser cutting, and then create the product images for Etsy, Shopify, and Amazon. All mockups and product images must be life-like and realistic.



MUST be able to create joined VECTOR LINE ART

Convert raster to vector images, understand color theory, create lifestyle scenes, photo-real product images to a lifestyle background, create A+ content, and social posts. -



Please send examples of your work. EXAMPLES are required for the interview.



Key Responsibilities

• Create to-scale, life-like product listing images for custom indoor and outdoor metal signs.

• Design vector-ready artwork for laser cutting, ensuring precision and manufacturability.

• Completing customer orders using a templated vectorized dxf file.

• Develop Amazon A+ content layouts that effectively showcase product features, benefits, and lifestyle applications.

• Work with product dimensions, color swatches, and textures to produce accurate, visually appealing mockups.

• Collaborate with marketing and production teams to maintain brand consistency.

• Optimize product listing images for Etsy, Amazon, Shopify, and other e-commerce platforms.





Qualifications

• Proven experience designing custom laser-cut metal signs or similar vector-based manufacturing products.

• Proficiency in Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and vector graphic creation.

• Knowledge of Amazon A+ Content guidelines and best practices.

• Ability to create realistic product renderings with correct scale, proportion, and color representation.

• Strong attention to detail and excellent time management skills.

• Experience with e-commerce product photography/mockups (preferred).





Preferred Skills

• Experience in visualizing powder-coated finishes, textures, and multiple color variations.

• Familiarity with Etsy, Shopify, and Amazon Seller Central image requirements.

• Understanding of manufacturing tolerances for laser cutting and metal fabrication.





Contract Details

• $ 3 per hour starting pay-

• Hours will be 25 to 30 hours a week, based on workload, to start.  ( hours could be up to 60 hours per week as needed) 

• Schedule: 11 PM to 5 AM GMT

• Monday to Friday USA days ( Tuesday to Saturday Philippine Work Days)

• Location: Remote – Philippines only (Philippine-based applicants).

• Requirements: Contract, NDA, Wise payment account, Timeproof time tracker, and daily timesheet.

• Paid weekly via Wise 

• Team: You will be working with our Philippines-based design team- in a remote capacity



----------------------------------------How to apply:--------------------------------------------------------

Please
:





Please include:



link to your online jobs profile- we only hire Filipino-based contractors, do not apply if you are based in other countries.

Resume

Portfolio

Include the Position that you are applying for

A brief detail about yourself and why you are best suited for the job.

When you are available to start if hired.

Acknowledgement that you read the job posting, including salary, work hours, NDA time, and attendance requirements.



Note: Please note if we accept your application, you will be required to interview within 24 hours.  These are immediate fill positions.

title: Meta Ads Video Editor

What you’ll do

 • Edit short-for
ta ads

Tools

 payment

title: Real Estate Transaction Coordinator – New York
description:
We are hiring a Transaction Coordinator with real U.S. real estate transaction experience who wants to grow with the team for the next 5–10 years.

This is a transaction CONTRACT to CLOSE role. 

Must have real estate transaction experience.



9AM–5PM EST (Monday–Friday)

Immediate Start Required

Full-Time | Remote | Long-Term Role



===============

About the Role:



You will manage transactions from executed contract to closing in a fast-paced New York real estate environment.



This role requires precision, deadline control, document discipline, and proactive follow-up.



Daniel is one of the top realtors in New York. 

He moves quickly. 

He is fair. 

He does not repeat instructions.



If you need constant reminders, this is not the role for you. 

If you thrive in structure, accountability, and execution — keep reading.



===============



Your responsibilities include: 



• Contract-to-close management

• Deadline tracking (inspection, financing, appraisal, board packages)

• Attorney coordination (NYC co-op / condo processes)

• Repair negotiation tracking

• Compliance & document completeness

• Escrow and wire confirmation follow-up

• Board package oversight

• Status reporting (clear, executive-level summaries)

• Real-time responsiveness when deal risk emerges



This role requires flexibility.



NYC deals move fast and shift quickly.



While core responsibilities are outlined above, additional transaction-related tasks may arise as market conditions or deal complexity evolve.



===============



Schedule

• Monday–Friday

• 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST

• Immediate start required

• Long-term commitment 



===============



Compensation: Hourly rate PLUS: 

• Performance-based bonuses

• 13th Month Pay eligibility (after 12 Months) 

• Long-term stability

 

===============

Phase 1 – Required Application Questions



All candidates must complete the questions below to be considered.



Daniel is extremely busy. 

His team will evaluate submissions.

Only the top five candidates will meet with Daniel directly.

 

1. Describe your direct U.S. real estate transaction experience.



Include:

• What state(s) you supported

• Number of transactions handled monthly

• Contract-to-close responsibilities

• Software used (Skyslope, Dotloop, AppFolio, etc.)



2. High-Stress Transaction Example



Describe one transaction where a closing was at risk.

Include:

• Purchase price

• What was at risk (financial + timeline)

• What you specifically did

• The measurable outcome



3. Deadline Control Scenario



A closing is scheduled in 5 days.

You discover:

• Appraisal report not yet received

• Buyer’s lender has not confirmed final underwriting

• Inspection credit agreement not documented in writing

• Attorney has not confirmed wire instructions



Explain:

• What you do in the next 24 hours

• What you escalate immediately

• What you document



Be specific.



===============



First Line of Application



First line of your response must read exactly:

TRANSACTION COORDINATOR – I HAVE U.S. REAL ESTATE EXPERIENCE



Applications that do not follow this instruction will not be reviewed.

This role supports long-term growth by ensuring our website ranks well, converts effectively, and reflects the Heirloom brand voice.

REQUIREMENT: YOU MUST BE FAMILIAR WITH SQUARESPACE

title: Supply Chain Manager
description:
Job Title: Supply Chain Manager (Women’s Fashion E-commerce)

Location: Remote

Language: English (spoken & written)



We’re a fast-growing women’s fashion e-commerce brand looking for a Supply Chain Manager who thrives on structure, accuracy, and clear communication. This role is crucial in ensuring that every single order is tracked, resolved, and fulfilled correctly, even when issues arise weeks later.



If you’re detail-obsessed, process-driven, and calm under complexity, this role is for you.



???? The Role



As Supply Chain Manager, you will be responsible for daily order tracking and issue resolution across suppliers, systems, and customer service. Many of our orders require active follow-up due to availability issues (size, color, or product availability), and your job is to make sure nothing slips through the cracks.



You will work primarily with:



ServicePoints (orders, suppliers, quotes, products)



Shopify



Internal tracking sheets & workflows



Customer Service team



???? Key Responsibilities

Order Monitoring & Tracking



Check daily orders one by one in Shopify and ServicePoints



Identify issues such as:



Product not available



Color not available



Size not available



Order still open after certain time





Issue Resolution & Customer Flow

When an issue is found, create a case for Customer Service

Maintain clear communication with Customer Service while they contact the customer

Track customer responses, even if they come weeks later

Once a solution is confirmed (e.g. new color or size):

Create a new Shopify order with correct customer details and preferences



Workflow & Process Management



Build and maintain personal workflows, sheets, and tracking systems

Use triggers, statuses, and notes to avoid confusion across multiple open cases

Ensure no order is missed, delayed, or mishandled

Continuously improve processes for clarity and scalability



Communication

Work closely with Customer Service

Keep communication structured, documented, and timely

Flag recurring supply issues proactively



???? What We’re Looking For



You are someone who:



Has experience in supply chain, order management, or operations (e-commerce preferred)



Is extremely detail-oriented and organised



Is comfortable working with:



Order management systems (like ServicePoints or similar)



Shopify



Spreadsheets & workflow tracking



Understands how easily orders can get lost without structure—and actively prevents that



Can manage many open cases at once without losing overview



Communicates clearly and professionally in English



Works independently and takes ownership



???? What We Offer



A key operational role in a growing women’s fashion brand



Remote working environment



A role with real responsibility and impact



Opportunity to build and optimise systems, not just follow them



Long-term collaboration if performance is strong



???? How to Apply



Please send:



A short motivation



Your experience with supply chain, order management, or e-commerce operations



Examples of how you stay organised when handling many cases at once



We’re looking for someone who sees complexity not as chaos—but as something to structure and master.

title: Cloud Technician – AI Infrastructure & Deploymen
description:
Cloud Technician – AI Infrastructure & Deployment



The Role



We're looking for a hands-on Cloud Technician who can bridge the gap between AI models and production-ready infrastructure. You'll be responsible for deploying AI services to cloud environments, building and maintaining the backend systems that power them, and ensuring everything runs reliably at scale. If you're someone who enjoys connecting the dots between machine learning, backend engineering, and cloud architecture, this role is for you.



 What You'll Do



- Deploy, host, and manage AI models and automation services on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)

- Build and maintain backend APIs and services that connect AI models to client-facing applications

- Set up and manage cloud infrastructure including servers, containers, networking, and storage

- Configure CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment of AI workloads

- Monitor system performance, uptime, and costs — optimizing where needed

- Implement security best practices for cloud environments handling sensitive data

- Collaborate with our AI and development teams to architect scalable, reliable solutions

- Troubleshoot production issues and maintain documentation for all infrastructure



What We're Looking For



- Strong understanding of backend development (Python, Node.js, or similar)

- Experience deploying and serving AI/ML models in production (e.g., using Docker, Kubernetes, or serverless functions)

- Familiarity with RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and message queues

- Working knowledge of containerization (Docker) and orchestration tools

- Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or Pulumi

- Comfortable with Linux server administration and shell scripting

- Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently



Nice to Have



- Experience with GPU-based cloud instances for AI inference

- Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face, LangChain)

- Knowledge of vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Qdrant)

- Experience with monitoring and observability tools (Datadog, Grafana, Prometheus)

- Understanding of AI API providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere) and how to integrate them into backend systems

title: Dedicated Executive Assistant to the Founder & CEO

title: Bookkeeping & Finance Coordinator (Hospitality) – Remote, Part-time
description:
Are you a master of organization, reconciliation, and financial clarity? We are looking for an experienced Bookkeeping & Finance Coordinator to take full control of our monthly financial preparation.



This is not an accounting role; you will be our internal engine. Your goal is to ensure our books are so clean, organized, and reconciled that our external accountant can file our taxes without having to ask a single question.



The Role

We are a hospitality business that needs a reliable partner to manage our monthly finance cycle. You will be responsible for getting us "accountant-ready" by the 10th of every month.



Your responsibilities include:



- Reconciling all bank and credit card transactions.

- Collecting, digitizing, and filing all invoices and receipts.

- Matching income streams (
, Stripe, Cloudbeds, etc.).

- Categorizing expenses by property and budget category.

- Maintaining a pristine Google Drive folder structure.

- Providing clear, concise notes on any discrepancies or missing items.



Requirements

Proven Experience: Demonstrated track record of reconciling bank statements and organizing financial documents.

Tech Savvy: Expert proficiency in Google Drive and Excel/Google Sheets.

Communication: Fluent in English (written and verbal).



Nice to Have: Experience with Xero, QuickBooks, or Holded; prior experience in the hospitality/short-term rental industry; basic awareness of Spanish invoices/tax documentation.



Availability: Starting at 10–15 hours/week (with potential to ramp up).

title: Real Estate Technical VA – AI SEO & Content Management
description:
I am looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to help update my real estate website for Generative Engine Optimization (GEO).  The goal is to ensure my services are recognized and recommended by AI platforms.



This is a technical execution role.  I have already developed the specific instructions and strategy; I need a partner to execute the "grind" of the work.  You will be using my Peec.ai account to identify high-value search prompts and a widget and ai to implement the content updates.



Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis: Review visibility data in Peec.ai to identify and prioritize prompts with 4 and 5-bar frequency statuses and others that I may select, which are appropriate for my industry.



Content Implementation: Take high-frequency search topics that are recommended and generate/edit professional, persuasive content to address them.  Most of the work here is done by ai.  Your job is to follow the instructions and create the content using the tools I provide.  Ultimately, you'll create the content in draft form, and I will do my final review and publish.  



Website Updates: Accurately place content into my Squarespace website in draft format for me to review and publish.



Quality Control: Ensure instructions are carried out exactly as specified, and communicate with me if there are any questions or concerns.



Requirements:

-- English fluency (written, reading, and spoken) is a strict requirement.

-- Ability to follow detailed instructions accurately and without skipping steps.

--Experience with GEO/ Ai SEO, and content management. 

--Experience with Squarespace websites.



Bonuses (if you have experience with any of these, that is more attractive to me):

-- Familiarity with real estate terminology.

-- Experience with writing, editing, and proofreading.

-- Experience using AI tools (Gemini, ChatGPT, Copilot, Claude, etc) to refine and professionalize content.

-- Experience with Peec or other similar tools to help with GEO/ Ai SEO, etc.



This is a long-term relationship.  Iniitally, there will be more hours required to get setup.  I would estimate 20-40 hours of work per week to get started for a week or two and then 5-20 hours per week to maintain.

, and other platforms.

title: SOCIAL MEDIA VA – HUBSPOT ENGAGEMENT & COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT
description:
ABOUT VSL

Vanderburgh Sober Living is a nonprofit organization that supports addiction recovery group homes across the United States. We exist to make community-based sober housing more accessible, and we do this by equipping and supporting local operators through shared standards, tools, and services.



WHY WORK HERE?

We pay well and treat our team with respect and transparency. Our VAs have real growth opportunities and a voice in how work gets done. We do not micromanage or use invasive time trackers because we hire professionals and trust them to perform. In return, we expect high standards, strong execution, and consistent follow-through. We are not building a revolving door of short-term hires. We are building a long-term team of A-players who take ownership, deliver results, and want to grow with a mission-driven organization. Learn more: 



POSITION SUMMARY

We are hiring a Social Media VA focused on disciplined posting, daily engagement, and CRM follow-through inside HubSpot. This is not primarily a content-creation role. You will use Canva templates we provide, post strategically through HubSpot, and actively manage conversations that turn into qualified inquiries. We compensate well and expect strong performance. We are not looking to cycle through VAs or hire short-term side hustlers. We want long-term A-players who take ownership, execute consistently, and grow with the company.



DUTIES

-- Monitor social platforms daily and follow up on DMs throughout the workday.

-- Respond to comments and messages professionally and move qualified conversations into HubSpot CRM.

-- Create simple branded posts using our Canva templates.

-- Schedule and publish content consistently through HubSpot.

-- Proactively engage in outbound conversations and participate in relevant groups and communities.



QUALIFICATIONS

-- Experience: 3+ years managing social media for U.S.-based businesses.

-- English: strong written and conversational fluency.

-- Tools & software: HubSpot (Marketing & CRM), Canva, Meta Business Suite, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Office.

-- Skills: detail-oriented, disciplined, organized, proactive, strong follow-through, and able to execute without constant oversight.

-- Internet & setup: reliable high-speed connection, backup plan, and quiet workspace.



SCHEDULE

40 hours per week, flexible hours with 50% overlap with U.S. Eastern Time, Monday through Friday.



COMPENSATION

We compensate well for experienced professionals and offer long-term growth opportunities. Please include your desired monthly or hourly USD rate in your application.



HOW TO APPLY

-- Reply subject: “SOCIAL – [YOUR NAME]”.

-- Include: a short introduction, your social media experience, your expected rate, your weekly availability, and a link to your portfolio or examples of work.

-- Briefly describe your experience using HubSpot for scheduling and engagement.



Applications without the word SOCIAL in the subject line will not be reviewed.

description:
We’re a fast-growing landscaping and pest control company based in the United States, and we’re building a team that feels like family. We’re tight-knit, supportive, and serious about rewarding people who show up and give their best. You won’t be just another employee here — you’ll be a key part of how we grow.



You’ll be joining two Filipino tea
mbers who are already thriving with us. We’ve got your back from day one.



What You’ll Be Doing



You will be following up with warm inbound leads coming in from social media (no cold calling), having friendly and confident conversations to close deals over the phone, sending quotes and estimates to potential customers, and managing leads and customer info inside GoHighLevel (GHL) and PestRoutes CRM using our Quo phone system.



What We Offer

$8.00 USD per hour base pay, commission on every deal you close, company-wide bonuses when the team wins, 100% remote work from home, full training provided with a proven script, Filipino teammates to work alongside, flexible schedule, and real growth opportunity as we expand fast and promote from within.



What We’re Looking For



Strong spoken English is required as you’ll be speaking with US customers daily. We care more about your attitude than your resume — hunger and heart matter most. You’ll need a reliable internet connection, a quiet workspace, and comfort learning new tools like GHL, PestRoutes, and Quo (all training provided). You should be self-motivated, punctual, and someone who takes ownership and treats customers like they matter.



Schedule



Saturday full-time hours and Monday through Friday or Tuesday through Friday part-time hours, all in Pacific Standard Time (PST). (must be able to work Saturday.) 



How to Apply

Send a short voice recording of 1 to 2 minutes introducing yourself and telling us why you’d be great in a sales role. You can also include the following numbered: 1) Your name, 2) Your available hours in PST, 3) One reason you’d be great at closing deals.



 We respond to every serious applicant.

title: Senior Graphic Designer + Portfolio Buildout Specialist (Web + Mockup + A.I. + Motion)
description:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT:



I am looking for someone who is focused on innovation, trends, and the "what's next" in the design world. I am NOT looking for someone who creates designs for corporate brands or standard marketing materials that can't break that mold. Must be able to break the marketing mold and instead develop designs that communicate a feeling and are "looks" forward. Your portfolio MUST show this and your ability to develop cool projects not just corporate used assets. I'm an experienced Art Director and Graphic Designer based in the U.S. looking to build a standout portfolio that truly reflects the caliber of my work. The problem isn't the work — it's the time. I'm buried in client projects and need a talented, senior-level creative partner to take everything I've already designed and transform it into a polished, dynamic, and visually impressive portfolio website and project presentation system.

This is not a task-taking role. I want a true collaborator — someone who will absorb my vision, contribute their own creative ideas, push back when they have a better solution, and help elevate the final result beyond what either of us could do alone.



The Website: 
v or Comparable Platform (This Is Critical)

My portfolio site is currently being built on 
v, an AI-powered web design platform, and this piece of the project is just as important as the design work itself. Here's why this matters so much: once the project is complete, I need to be able to manage, edit, and add to the site myself — without hiring a developer every time I want to swap out a project or update a section. 
v makes this possible through its AI chat-based editing interface, which lets non-developers make real changes without touching code. If you are experienced with 
v, you move to the top of the list immediately.

That said, I am open to other platforms — but only if they meet the same criteria:

- The site must be a real, live, published website (not a mockup or template PDF)

- I must be able to edit and add to it myself after handoff without needing to rehire

- It should support a visually rich, modern, and dynamic design — not a cookie-cutter template look



If you're proposing an alternative to 
v, tell me specifically what platform you'd use, why it's better for this project, and how it gives me the same self-service editing capability. I'm open to the conversation — just come with a clear recommendation and reasoning.



WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:



- Taking my existing design files (print, social, logo/branding, vector assets, etc.) across multiple campaigns and brands and building cohesive, story-driven project presentations

- Placing designs onto high-quality 4K photorealistic mockups so the work comes to life beyond flat files

- Crafting visual storyboards and case study layouts that communicate the creative strategy and execution behind each project

- Building and publishing the actual portfolio website on 
v or an agreed-upon alternative that meets the self-editing requirement

- Incorporating motion graphics or subtle animations to make the portfolio feel modern and dynamic (AI-assisted motion is acceptable)

- Maintaining a strong understanding of American design culture and what resonates with U.S.-based hiring teams and creative directors





REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:



- Senior-level graphic design experience — strong eye and deep experience across branding, print, and digital

- Mockup & presentation design — expert-level ability to composite designs onto 4K realistic mockups and build compelling case study layouts

- Web design AND development — you need to build a real, live, published site, not just design it in Figma and call it done

- 
v experience — strongly preferred; if you have it, lead with it

- Motion graphics / animation — at minimum, comfortable using AI tools to add movement and life to portfolio pieces

- AI design tools — proficient with AI-powered design workflows (Higgsfield, Nano Banana Pro, Firefly, or similar)

- Strong grasp of American aesthetics and design culture — this portfolio targets U.S. companies and hiring directors, so your sensibility needs to reflect that





WHAT I AM NOT LOOKING FOR:



A "yes person." I don't want someone who just executes instructions. I want someone who reviews my inspiration, understands the goal, and brings their own strong creative perspective to the table. If you have a better idea, say so.



PROJECT TIMELINE AND COMMUNICATION:



- Target completion: 4–8 weeks depending on scope and workflow speed

- Weekly check-ins via video call or messaging to review progress and align on direction

- Responsive communication is required — I need to know things are moving

title: Experienced AI UGC Video Editor – $1,000-$1,500/Month

title: Python Developer for Futures Trading Bot (Part-Time Remote)
description:
About Us



We're a small, focused AI trading team that has successfully built and deployed a proprietary futures trading bot. Our bot is live, profitable, and executing trades daily. We're now looking for a skilled Python developer to join us as the dedicated technical owner of this system.



The Opportunity



This is a long-term, part-time remote position (10 hours/week) with significant growth potential. You'll be the technical guardian of our trading bot, ensuring it runs flawlessly and continues to evolve. This role offers the unique opportunity to work at the intersection of software development and quantitative trading, where your code directly impacts real financial outcomes.



What You'll Do



Keep Our Bot Running Smoothly



•

Monitor daily operations and ensure 99%+ uptime



•

Quickly identify and resolve any technical issues



•

Maintain security, update dependencies, and manage infrastructure



Optimize Performance



•

Implement new trading strategies based on our team's research



•

Optimize code for speed and efficiency



•

Conduct backtesting to validate strategy improvements



•

Propose technical enhancements that improve profitability



Collaborate with Our Trading Team



•

Translate trading ideas into clean, robust Python code



•

Provide weekly performance reports and insights



•

Participate in strategy discussions and offer technical guidance



•

Maintain clear documentation of the system



What We're Looking For



Required Skills:



•

Expert-level Python with strong experience in Pandas, NumPy, and data analysis



•

API Integration Experience - You've worked extensively with RESTful and WebSocket APIs, ideally from cryptocurrency or futures exchanges



•

Trading Knowledge - You understand futures markets, order types, leverage, and risk management concepts



•

Infrastructure Skills - Comfortable with Linux, cloud platforms (AWS/GCP), and database management



•

Git Proficiency - Clean commits, clear documentation, version control best practices



Ideal Candidate:



•

Has built or maintained trading bots, algorithmic trading systems, or financial applications



•

Understands the importance of uptime and reliability in live trading environments



•

Can work independently and proactively identify issues before they become problems



•

Excellent written English communication skills



•

Experience working remotely with US-based teams



Work Details



Time Commitment: 10 hours per week (flexible scheduling)



Communication:



•

Daily brief updates via Slack/



•

Weekly 30-minute video call



•

Must be responsive to urgent issues (we'll define clear protocols)



Work Style:



•

Primarily asynchronous work with some scheduled overlap



•

You'll have autonomy to structure your time



•

We value results and reliability over rigid schedules



Why This Role is Great



? Work on a live, profitable system - Your work has immediate, measurable impact



? Long-term partnership - We're looking for someone to grow with us, not a short-term contractor



? Flexible remote work - Work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection



? Learn algorithmic trading - Gain deep insights into quantitative trading strategies



? Small team, big impact - Direct collaboration with the trading team, no corporate bureaucracy



? Competitive compensation - We pay well for quality work and value long-term relationships



How to Apply



Please submit:



1.

Your resume/CV highlighting relevant Python and trading experience



2.

Portfolio or GitHub showing examples of your work (trading bots, API integrations, or similar projects)



3.

Brief cover letter (3-4 paragraphs) answering:



•

What's your experience with trading systems or financial applications?



•

Describe a challenging bug or performance issue you've resolved



•

Why are you interested in working on a futures trading bot?







We'll prioritize candidates who:



•

Have demonstrable experience with trading bots or financial APIs



•

Can provide references from previous remote/international clients



•

Show strong communication skills in their application



Next Steps



Selected candidates will go through:



1.

Initial screening call (15 minutes)



2.

Technical interview (45 minutes) - We'll discuss your experience and approach to common scenarios



3.

Paid trial project (5-10 hours) - A real task from our backlog to assess fit



4.

3-month trial period - Full engagement with the option to continue long-term

title: Short-Form Video Editor + Social Media Poster (Multi-Brand)
description:

title: Senior Media Buyer & Client Account Manager - Life Insurance Lead Generation
description:
Senior Media Buyer & Client Account Manager - Life Insurance Lead Generation



Type: Full-Time



About the Role

We are a fast-growing performance marketing agency managing 20–30 active clients and approximately $100,000 in monthly ad spend. Our clients are life insurance agents and agencies across the United States, and our entire business is built around a single goal: generating high-quality, qualified appointments and leads for them to sell life insurance policies.

We are looking for a highly experienced and autonomous Senior Media Buyer & Client Account Manager to take full ownership of this operation. This is not an entry-level position. The expectation is to maintain a 7% close rate on total leads generated across the client portfolio. This is a demanding role requiring 50-60 hours per week and a high level of commitment.



Who You Are

•A Proven Media Buyer: You have managed 6-7 figures in ad spend on Meta platforms. You live and breathe Ads Manager and know how to scale campaigns profitably.

•A True "Go-Getter": You are a highly autonomous, proactive self-starter. You don’t wait to be told what to do; you identify problems and create solutions.

•An Expert Client Manager: You excel at communication and can confidently manage 20+ client relationships simultaneously via Slack and video calls, providing weekly reports and strategic guidance.

•Tech-Savvy & Fast: You are highly proficient with Slack, GoHighLevel (GHL), Google Meet, and Zoom. You are organized, efficient, and built for a fast-paced environment.

•Obsessed with Performance: You are an analytical thinker who is driven by data and KPIs. You are relentlessly focused on hitting targets and driving measurable results for clients.



What You Will Be Doing

Media Buying & Performance Optimization: You will manage and optimize ad campaigns across all active client accounts on the Meta Ads platform, overseeing a combined monthly spend of ~$100,000. Your primary objective is to hit our client KPI of a 7% close rate on leads generated. This includes making any necessary changes within the ad account and the associated funnels (e.g., in GoHighLevel).

Creative Strategy & High-Volume Testing: You will be responsible for developing, launching, and iterating on 30–50 new ad creatives per week, including both AI video ads and high-performing static image ads.



Full-Cycle Account Management: You are the primary owner of the client relationship. This includes daily communication in Slack, delivering weekly performance reports, and hopping on client calls as needed.



Internal Strategy & Collaboration: You will meet 1-on-1 daily with the agency owner to review performance, align on strategy, and plan priorities.
