title: Remote Medical Front Desk & Scheduling Coordinator (U.S. Pain Clinic | ECW/eClinicalWorks)
description:
REMOTE MEDICAL FRONT DESK & SCHEDULING COORDINATOR (U.S. PAIN CLINIC | ECW/eCLINICALWORKS)



TYPE: Full-time (40 hrs/week)

PAY: $5–$7 USD/hour (based on experience) + BONUSES

BONUSES (STRONG PERFORMANCE): 90-DAY BONUS + 180-DAY BONUS

SCHEDULE: Must work U.S. business hours (Central Time)



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a small U.S.-based pain management clinic. This role is phone-heavy and patient-facing. You will be the voice of our clinic and must be professional, calm, and easy to understand by U.S. patients. Training is structured and takes about 2–3 months, so we are looking for someone who wants a long-term position.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

- Answer inbound calls from patients (new + established) and resolve issues or route properly

- Schedule new patient appointments and follow-ups; reschedule/cancel as needed

- Make outbound calls to get patients scheduled and confirm appointments

- Handle calls from pharmacies and other medical offices; coordinate messages accurately

- Understand insurance basics and support prior authorization workflow (gather info, follow up, track status)

- Comfortable discussing fees/cash prices and collecting payments per clinic policy

- EHR/ECW tasks (preferred): create new patients, update demographics/insurance, route/assign faxes, create telephone encounters/tasks, document calls clearly



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (PLEASE DO NOT APPLY WITHOUT THIS)

- Minimum 1–2+ years in U.S. healthcare front desk / scheduling / patient access (remote or in-clinic)

- Strong conversational English (clear, confident, natural pacing; easily understood by U.S. callers)

- Strong communication + ability to understand what patients are requesting

- Comfortable being on the phone a large portion of the day

- Basic understanding of U.S. healthcare workflow: insurance, prior authorizations, referrals, copays/deductibles



PREFERRED (STRONG PLUS)

- eClinicalWorks (ECW) experience (especially: new patient creation, fax routing, telephone encounters/tasks)

- Experience in pain management / ortho / spine clinics

- Worked with MedVA / Hello Rache / similar healthcare VA companies

- Light marketing/sales skill for converting inquiries into scheduled appointments



WORK SETUP (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

- Reliable high-speed internet + backup connection plan (mobile hotspot or secondary internet)

- Quiet private workspace suitable for HIPAA-sensitive calls

- Working headset + microphone

- Webcam/camera available for training and check-ins

- No overemployment during scheduled hours (this role requires focus and consistency)



COMPLIANCE

- Willing to provide NBI Clearance (Philippines) AFTER a conditional offer / BEFORE start date

- Willing to follow confidentiality/HIPAA processes and clinic SOPs



HOW TO APPLY (FOLLOW EXACTLY OR YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED)

1) Start your application message with: FRONT DESK READY



2) Answer these 6 questions (short but specific):

- Q1: How many years have you worked as a U.S. healthcare front desk / scheduler, and what specialty?

- Q2: Describe your ECW experience (be specific: new patient creation, fax routing, tasks/telephone encounters, scheduling).

- Q3: What is a prior authorization, and what steps have you personally handled?

- Q4: Write your exact spoken response to: “Do you take my insurance?” (2–4 sentences)

- Q5: How would you respond to an upset patient who says: “Nobody called me back”? (2–4 sentences)

- Q6: Confirm YES/NO to each: (a) can work U.S. Central Time consistently, (b) have reliable internet + backup plan, (c) not working another job during the same scheduled hours, (d) have a webcam for training.



3) VOICE RECORDING (REQUIRED): 60–90 seconds, MP3 or M4A

Read this script (word-for-word is fine):

“Thank you for calling our clinic. This is (Name). How can I help you today?

If you’re calling to schedule a new patient appointment, I can help with that.

May I have your full name, date of birth, and the best call-back number?”



SUBMIT YOUR AUDIO USING OPTION A (ATTACH FILE OR GOOGLE DRIVE LINK)

A) CREATE THE AUDIO FILE (MP3 OR M4A)

Choose ONE method:



- iPhone (Voice Memos):

  - Open the Voice Memos app

  - Record 60–90 seconds

  - Tap the recording, then tap the Share icon

  - Choose “Save to Files” (this creates an M4A file)

  - Rename it like: LASTNAME_FIRSTNAME_FRONTDESK.m4a



- Android (Voice Recorder):

  - Open your Voice Recorder app

  - Record 60–90 seconds

  - Save/export as M4A or MP3

  - Rename it like: LASTNAME_FIRSTNAME_FRONTDESK.mp3



- Laptop/PC:

  - Use any recorder app/software to record 60–90 seconds

  - Save/export as MP3 or M4A

  - Rename it like: LASTNAME_FIRSTNAME_FRONTDESK.mp3



B) SUBMIT THE AUDIO (CHOOSE 1)

- Option 1 (Preferred): Attach the MP3/M4A file directly in your OnlineJobs.ph application message (if attachments are available to you).

- Option 2: Google Drive link

  - Upload the MP3/M4A to Google Drive

  - Right-click the file (or tap the three dots on mobile) and select “Share”

  - Under “General access,” change to: Anyone with the link

  - Set role to: Viewer

  - Copy the link and paste it into your OnlineJobs.ph application message



IMPORTANT

- Do NOT
 the audio. Submit via OnlineJobs.ph message only (attachment or Google Drive link).

- Applications that follow instructions completely will be prioritized.

title: Client Success & Admin Operations Assistant
description:
About Us



We are a growing continuing education and travel-based company serving healthcare professionals across the United States. We host destination-based educational events (including cruise conferences) and offer virtual courses.



We are expanding and looking for a highly organized, long-term tea
mber who wants stability, responsibility, and room to grow.



This is not a short-term freelance role. We are building a team.



Position Overview



You will manage our Gmail inbox, onboarding process, payment tracking, and JotForm systems. Your role is critical in ensuring our client experience is smooth, organized, and professional.



You will be expected to respond to as many
s as possible independently, using clear guidelines and templates. The goal is to protect the founder’s time while maintaining excellent client communication.



You will work directly with the founder and help maintain and improve internal systems as we grow.



Core Responsibilities



Inbox Management (Primary Responsibility)



Manage and organize Gmail inbox daily



Categorize and label incoming
s



Respond to the majority of
s independently using provided guidelines and templates



Use judgment to determine when to respond and when to escalate



Flag only high-level or sensitive
s for review



Follow up on unanswered inquiries



Maintain professional tone and respond within 24 hours



Goal: The founder should only need to review a small percentage of
s that require decision-making.



Onboarding & Guest Management



Send booking confirmations and payment links



Track guest information in Google Sheets



Monitor missing required information



Maintain onboarding checklists



Manage JotForm submissions



Prepare and distribute certificates



Ensure each guest moves smoothly through onboarding



Payment Tracking



Track deposits and recurring monthly payments



Monitor payment due dates



Send reminder
s before deadlines



Flag failed payments immediately



Maintain accurate Google Sheets payment tracker



Provide weekly payment summary updates



JotForm Management



Create and edit JotForms as needed



Build forms with conditional logic



Connect JotForms to Google Sheets



Set up certificate delivery workflows



Monitor submissions for accuracy



Maintain organized form systems



Systems & Organization



Work within ClickUp for task management



Maintain organized Google Drive folders



Update CRM records



Support
 automation in MailChimp



Follow SOPs and suggest workflow improvements



Required Skills & Experience



Strong written English



Experienced with Gmail



Experienced with Google Docs and Google Sheets



Experience tracking payments or recurring billing



Experience onboarding clients or event participants



Experienced creating and managing JotForms



Familiar with CRM systems



Familiar with MailChimp



Familiar with ClickUp



Highly organized and detail-oriented



Able to work independently with minimal supervision



Reliable internet connection



Hours & Compensation



10–15 hours per week to start



Long-term opportunity



Potential for increased hours and responsibility



Compensation based on experience



How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:



A short paragraph describing your experience managing inboxes and tracking payments.



A description of a JotForm you have built (including logic or integrations used).



A screenshot of a Google Sheet you have created.



Your experience using CRM systems, MailChimp, and ClickUp.



Your internet speed.



Your desired hourly rate.



Include the word “Magic” at the top of your application.



Applications missing requested information will not be considered.

title: Virtual Assistant Needed to Help Set Up Jane App for Telehealth Medical Practice
description:
I am looking for a reliable virtual assistant to assist with setup of my Jane App electronic health record for a telehealth primary care and medical practice.



Services include sick visits, acute care visits, medical weight management, women's health visits, prescription management, documentation services, and medical consultations.



Responsibilities include creating appointment types, setting visit durations, entering services and pricing, uploading intake and consent forms, organizing provider schedules, enabling reminders, and assisting with online booking setup based on instructions provided.



Experience with healthcare administration or EHR systems is preferred but not required. Training and step by step guidance will be provided.



This is a short term project estimated at ten to twenty five hours over one to two weeks. Attention to detail and good communication skills are required.

title: Social Media Manager for Telehealth Medical Practice
description:
I am looking for a social media manager to help grow and manage social media accounts for a telehealth primary care medical practice.



Responsibilities include creating and scheduling posts, developing healthcare related content, managing Instagram and
 pages, responding to comments or messages when needed, and helping increase online visibility and patient engagement.



Content will focus on primary care services, sick visits, medical weight management, women's health, wellness education, and telehealth services.



Experience managing business or healthcare social media accounts is preferred. Basic graphic design skills using Canva or similar tools are required.



This is an ongoing part time role estimated at five to ten hours per week.

title: Creator Talent Recruiter (Commission Based Sales Role)
description:
Overview



We are a fast growing creator network seeking a Philippines based recruiter to source and sign Filipino content creators.



This is a commission based recruiting and sales role. You will earn per ACTIVE creator you successfully bring into the agency.



This is not an admin position. You will be doing daily outreach, conversations, and follow ups.



?



What You Will Do



• Find and research content creators

• Send daily outreach messages

• Build conversations and answer questions

• Screen creators for quality and consistency

• Pre qualify strong candidates

• Track outreach and sign ups

• Guide approved creators through onboarding



?



What This Role Is



This is a performance based recruiting and sales position.

You will be reaching out daily.

You will handle objections.

You will follow up consistently.

You will be paid based on results.



?



KPIs



• Outreach volume

• Response rate

• Qualified creators

• Signed active creators

• Retention of recruited creators



?



Requirements



• Must be based in the Philippines

• Strong understanding of creator culture

• Clear written and spoken English

• Comfortable with outreach and sales conversations

• Organized and self managed



Experience with influencer recruiting, sales, or social media is a plus.



?



Growth Opportunity



Top performers may move into:

• Lead Recruiter

• Talent Manager

• Regional Recruitment Lead



?



How To Apply



Submit:

• Resume

• Short paragraph explaining your experience with creator culture

• Example of how you would recruit a creator

• Screenshot of a creator you believe has strong potential and why



Details about commission structure will be discussed during the interview.

title: Senior Accountant (Real Estate)
description:
About the Role

The company is a growing multifamily real estate investment and property management company serving communities across the Southeast. The company manages a multi-entity property portfolio and operates in a fast-paced, detail-driven environment where financial accuracy directly impacts operational performance and investment decisions.



Leadership expects clean numbers, disciplined reporting, and strong ownership of the accounting function. This role replaces the current onshore Staff Accountant and serves as a key financial partner to the Controller. You will oversee full-cycle accounting across multiple properties, review downstream work, and ensure financial reporting is accurate, timely, and audit-ready.



This client delegates real responsibility. They expect you to own your numbers, proactively identify discrepancies, and bring solutions — not just surface problems. Clear communication, tight month-end execution, and follow-through are critical to building trust.



Responsibilities:



Oversee full-cycle accounting for multiple multifamily properties and related entities

Maintain general ledger accuracy, including coding, allocations, and account classifications

Review and approve reconciliations prepared by the AP Specialist, including vendor statements and property-level accounts

Lead month-end, quarter-end, and year-end close processes with on-time financial delivery

Prepare and deliver balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow reports for leadership review

Build and manage property-level budgets, forecasts, and detailed variance analysis

Perform higher-level financial analysis to identify trends, risks, and operational improvement opportunities

Ensure compliance with GAAP and real estate accounting standards across entities

Strengthen internal controls and documentation to improve audit readiness

Support property acquisitions and dispositions with financial modeling and due diligence analysis

Recommend and implement workflow and system improvements to increase reporting accuracy and efficiency



Requirements:



5–7+ years of real estate or multifamily property management accounting experience

Strong multi-entity accounting experience

Proven leadership of month-end and year-end close processes

Experience directly supporting a Controller or senior finance leader

Strong working knowledge of GAAP and real estate accounting principles

Experience reviewing AP workflows and reconciliations

Proficiency in RealPage (preferred), AppFolio, or similar property management software

Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, including financial modeling and variance analysis

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Real Estate, or related field

Full professional English fluency

Availability to work Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM EST

Demonstrated track record of meeting deadlines without follow-up and maintaining audit-ready financial records



Benefits:



Competitive salary

Paid US holidays

Paid wellness days

Health & wellness allowance

Monthly profit sharing

AI, Operations, and Leadership upskilling

Dedicated Success Manager and long-term placement support
